story:
Summary

EphEx is a start-up organization with the goal of providing quality exhibition and performance space for young and burgeoning artists of all genres to encourage cultural development in New York City. But to start things off,  we'd like to give everyone a little taste of what is to come, by producing a pop-up exhibition featuring the art of Rain Embuscado.

Rain is a journalist and visual artist from New York City who strives to create large scale mixed media compositions with an emphasis on historical and social conflict. He urges his viewers to consider the struggles of a contemporary multiculturalism by melding his own unique experiences with the diverse culture of the city that surrounds him. Curated by Kaylee Alexander, a certified appraiser of Fine Arts and M.A. student at New York University's Institute of Fine Arts, this inaugural exhibition will explore what it means to live, survive and exist within New York's diverse cultural landscape. 

The Budget

  • Space Rental for 1 Month Exhibition, August 2015 (including associated cleaning and staffing fees, plus gallery supplies): $13,800
  • Event Insurance: $500
  • Marketing Materials (postcards, flyers, catalogues, business cards, and postage): $2000
  • Website Management (domain name for a year and year subscription to Constant Contact): $1000
  • Opening Reception (food, wine, security, invitations & postage, and additional event insurance): $2000
  • Incidentals: $1000 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk will be raising enough money to rent the space and designing the exhibition. It is our goal to hold the three week exhibition in the Summer of 2015, but if we cannot raise the money fast enough it may be be pushed to the Fall of 2015.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate to our cause, we are more than happy to take on volunteers!

Currently we are seeking volunteer bloggers to provide content for the 'Artist Spotlight' section of our website. Ideally we will alternate between a featured visual artist and theatre artist every week. We would like someone with art blogging experience and a B.A. in a related field is preferred. 

We will also be looking for a volunteer social media correspondent to help us get the word out, as well as volunteers to help us staff the gallery during the run of the exhibition. 

So if you are interested in getting involved in any capacity, please message us for more details. 

http://www.reportcrowd.com/game/94-art/207550-e...

story:
The Arctraveler 

 

The Arctraveler encompasses a plethora of concepts, events and characters influenced by Armenian fairy tales, epos and mythology. A keen eye will also find references to ancient Middle Eastern and Europian legends and mythology.

In this realm, magic has somewhat distorted the conventional history and traditions, and reality presents itself in new, exotic colors.

The Arctraveler follows the adventures of a young princess, Nersehanuysh, daughter of Assyrian king Nerseh-Adad. Events start in 8445 (according to old Armenian calendar, which is current AD 1167), the year after the birth of Vahagn, god of fire, thunder and war. Nersehanuysh accidentally shoots the crow of Angegh, one of the last living gods, who then confines her wrists with the Chains of death. In order to escape Angegh’s curse, she has to fulfill his task of killing the leader of Armenian noble families, Parnak Bagratuni, who is a threat to Angegh’s rule.

 

About me 

 

My name is Yelena Nersesyan aka Helen Derunc. I work as a comics artist at Panicomik lab, a comics studio startup at Tumo Center for Creative Technologies in Yerevan, Armenia. I started my comics career 2 years ago after having worked in the fields of animation and illustration.

I began to work on this script 6 years ago, and at some point I realized that the best medium to tell this story is a graphic novel. So I decided to commit myself to the industry and started my studies and research.

One of my main goals is to contribute to the development of Armenian comics scene, and I believe my books will help advance this art in my country.

 

What you get when you back this campaign:

 

First 20 backers who buy the books will get free postcards and stickers.

Backers, who buy the books on 1st September will get free pins.

 

1. The Arctraveler is a full-color, hardcover, ~60 page graphic novel.

2.Postcards 

3. Main character stickers 

4.Princess Nersehanuysh/Parnak pins 

5. Playing cards with main characters from all 5 books

6.Free shipping in Armenia

story:
Short Summary

My name's Don Barnhart.  I'm a comedian, hypnotist, author and filmmaker.  I travel the world and have been noticing bad art.  I'm sick and tired of the condesending nature of art that looks like a child could have made it and is sold for millions.

One day, I told my wife I could do better with a paintbrush shoved up my ass.  She laughed and then she challenged me to do it.

I'm looking for funding to help this journey as I explore the world of "art".  If I get my funding, my wife will shove (gently) a paintbrush between my cheeks and I will paint a masterpiece for the world to enjoy.

With your help, we can show the world that beauty is in the brown eye of the beholder.  Please help and get behind this project!

We will film, photograph and then share my art work with the world.   The perks we are offering range from small contributions of $1 to help with supplies and getting a "thank you" on our website, a signed photographic print of the main artwork mailed to you, a tee shirt with a print of the masterpiece and motto on the rear of the shirt - "Beauty is in the brown eye" and for the ultimate art enthusiast and funder you will get the ultimate perk of an original painting done just for you along with a 2 nights hotel and round trip airfare to Vegas (from anywhere in the continental US)

If we achieve our goal, we will build a website, rent a venue and actually have a showing of my art in Las Vegas, NV

This is really a stupid idea but I'm willing to give it a shot.  This will help to finally answer if anything can be crowd funded.

Please be sure to share this and help us get the word out.  #assart

Don't be an ass and get behind this project.

story:
Sheila needs YOU!

Queenslanders! Burners! Wonksters of all stripes! 

Sheila, the Wonky Queenslander, is making a precarious journey through time and space to represent the Sunshine State at Burning Seed. She must travel 1500km through hostile New South Welsh territory in order to bring her steamy sounds and balmy beats to the Paddock. 

For those who don't know her, Sheila is an art car, boasting a bar, soundsystem, and a theme camp all of her own. And she makes a bloody good cocktail. 

To make the trip with no dramas she'll need a darn big trailer and a darn good driver. We're asking for your help to make it happen!

story:
West Union Cemetery

We have permission to paint the cemetery wall off highway 600 also known as W. Madison St. in a small town called Gibsonburg, Ohio. We are campaigning to raise money for a mural that we would like to have painted for our community and those resting in West Union Cemetery. 

A few years ago Rachel Garner, narrator in our video, had an idea to paint a mural on the empty wall on the north side of West Union Cemetery in Gibsonburg, Ohio. Her heart is close to this cemetery because her brother, who passed away at the young age of 21, is buried there. Rachel, her family, and many community members take flowers to their loved ones buried in West Union Cemetery. The cemetery became a place of solace and healing while talking to and remembering  loved ones buried there. The mural is more than a painting. It is a symbol of love and the passing of time. 

205 ft. long and 950 sq. ft.

This wall is HUGE which means we need a lot of preparation, supplies, time, and preservation for the mural. Our talented artist Megan LaCroix is taking on the job of painting this magnificent wall. Her concept for this mural is to paint the four seasons, spring, summer, fall, and winter, we experience in the midwest. The painting is an ode to the passing of time and the cycles of life. 

  • With your help we will be able to first clean the wall and fill in any major holes that may exist on the surface. 
  • Once the wall is clean we will need to paint it with a cement primer. This ensures the colors of the mural will be bright and the surface even enough to paint on.
  • We expect the mural to take about a month to paint. The money will also pay for our artist Megan LaCroix to paint the wall.
  • The last step is to seal the mural in order to preserve it. This ensures that it lasts a long time with out much maintenance. 
  • Megan has previously created large scale canvas paintings for ArtPrize 7 and several murals in Detroit, MI. Her mission is to paint meaningful pieces that uplift the communities she works in.  

Risks & Challenges

There is no stopping this train because it is already in motion but we risk not making enough money for all the supplies and to pay the artist for her time. The most important part of this project is to fund the supplies to complete to mural.

  • We have some help from the cemetery board but they cannot cover all of our expenses.
  • If we can't make all of our money in the Indiegogo platform, we will raise money in the community with door to door campaigning. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please share this post on any social media, send it out as an e-mail or call up a friend who supports the arts. 

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much. This project is not possible with out the support of others.

Peace and Love,

Rachel, Megan and the community of Gibsonburg, Ohio.

story:
"The Ellipses Project is a response to our culture’s avoidance of death. It suggests that art-making - which enables expression, presence, and the condensation of meaning - can be useful during the end-of-life period. During the Summer Internship Program both patients and artist-collaborators benefit from their work together."

The Project:

We are working with hospice patients ranging in age from 3 months to 104 years old. We are visiting patients at home, in hospitals, and various other facilities and are making art with them. We have had unforgettable experiences with patients, and we've grown as artists and people. We're making week-by-week video diaries to include in a series of short films that will convey our experiences.

The Goal:

To help us cover the cost of art supplies to use with these patients, we're offering a set of art prints for you to own - all designed and produced by us!

The Art:

The prints will be done on 5x7 linoleum blocks (with a 2 or 3 inch border). These prints with express our experiences from this summer. We'll be updating you on the print process as this campaign goes along.


THANK YOU SO MUCH FROM ALL OF US

story:
Circus Kazoo 

Circus Kazoo is an all-ages, all-levels welcome Circus centered in Grayslake, Illinois. "J", Circus Kazoo's fearless leader teaches and trains a variety of circus arts skills, doing her best to accommodate a diverse body of students. Over the last two years, she has joyfully watched as the acrobatics groups at her space have blossomed from a focus on basics to a wide variety of skills and talents. There has reached a point where the community would like to train higher technical levels of tricks, as well as higher levels physically, in space. So as to accommodate the increased demands but still maintain a high standard of safety, we have determined the purchase of a spotting belt will be necessary. We are asking for your help to make our communities' dreams a reality.

 

What we need:

Like any circus gear, proper safety spotting equipment can be quite pricey. Although some of the other circus arts are able to "earn their keep" easier, Circus Kazoo has done its best to make acrobatics affordable for all to participate. As such, the purchase of this equipment will take a very long time to be paid off via donations at Jams, or through the acrobatics classes taught each week. 

In total, we are asking for $800 to cover the purchase and installation of the spotting belt, and all necessary equipment to set it up in a safe, sustainable manner. 

If you wish to donate out of the spirit of community, we thank you! Donations large or small are welcome. If you actually want something for your money though, you're in luck!

By donating through this campaign, you can get earn private instruction from one of Circus Kazoo's highly experienced instructors, you can try out a new circus skill, or you can even bring the circus to you, by creating a custom workshop at your own studio.

 

We understand that not everyone can donate, so you can also help by passing this campaign along to friends and associates. Spread the word, spread the love, and come play with us and our new spotting belt, starting in January!

story:
WE'VE REACHED OUR GOAL! DONATE TO HELP US REACH A TOTAL OF $1,800 TO HAVE THE MAPS FRAMED ONCE THE RESTORATION PROCESS IS COMPLETED! 

Established in 1991, Intuit: The Center for Intuitive and Outsider Art is the only nonprofit organization in the United States that is dedicated solely to presenting self-taught and outsider art. A part of Intuit’s permanent exhibition, the Henry Darger Room Collection draws in museum visitors everyday. The room is unique in that it is now home to Darger’s fireplace, dresser, desk, magazines, books and art supplies he diligently collected throughout his life.

Though Intuit is not in possession of very much artwork from the enigmatic Henry Darger, we do have maps he illustrated to identify three of the locations he writes about in his Realms of the Unreal. One of these, showing the Blenging and Boyking Islands, has been framed and is currently on display in Paris at the Musée d’Art Moderne.

The other two maps are in bad condition. For years, they have been folded and poorly stored, subject to temperature change and dust buildup. The paper is at risk of tearing and falling to pieces as it has not been properly treated to handle wear and tear.

Fortunately, we have been in contact with Dmitri Rybchenkov’s Restoration Studio, where the maps will be properly treated. As soon as we have sufficient funds, the project will move forward.

The restoration will eliminate the creases that have taken hold of the folded maps, secure them to an archival backing material and frame them for display. Once conserved and framed properly, Intuit plans to include them in the display leading to the Henry Darger Room.

Contribute and become a part of the maps’ story. Your help will allow for a huge addition to the Darger Room experience at Intuit. Thank you!

story:
After a very successful campaign on KickStarter where we raised over $6,700, we want to bring Office Putty to the Indiegogo community. We have already hit our minimum order quantity and have Office Putty in stock ready to send out to our supporters.

The Office Putty Story.

Having an item to mold, form, and stretch is a great tool for the office to get your mind engaged, lose any stress and work up some new ideas. We discovered there is a need for a product that is specifically designed for adults, that is durable, maintains the perfect amount of resistance and can fit into an office environment.

That's how Office Putty came about, it is a moldable putty that feels great in your hands and helps unlock your mind's potential. 

Calm.

Stress balls are ok but wouldn’t you prefer the perfect amount of resistance along with durability? Office Putty engages and relaxes your hand muscles, which is proven to relieve stress and tension in the mind.   

Focus.

Ever find yourself playing with a pen when concentrating? This is because there is direct connection between your brain and your hands. Office Putty puts that connection into overdrive, activating the neurons you need to focus on the task at...hand.

Create.

Did you know, studies have found that exercising your hands can stimulate the creative area of the brain? Schools have been doing hand activation exercises with kids for years – what about us adults? Now it is time to unlock that new idea with Office Putty.

Other Features.

  • Manufactured in the USA
  • Non-sticky
  • Odourless
  • Never dries out
  • Non-toxic
  • Low profile colour for office use


What We'll Do When We Smash Our Goal.

Our plan is to develop an online ordering system, some slick new packaging and prepare to launch Office Putty into retail stores. We have all the skills and expertise necessary to make this happen, but we do require your support to ensure our product reaches its full potential. We encourage you to support and try out Office Putty for yourself.


We Are Ready To Go!

We have done our homework. A manufacturer has been sourced and the winning putty formula has been created. After our success on KickStarter we will have Office Putty in stock ready to send out to you!

We encourage you to support and try out Office Putty for yourself. 


We Are Ready To Go!
We have done our homework. A manufacturer has been sourced and the winning putty formula has been created. After our success on KickStarter we will have Office Putty in stock ready to send out to you!

story:
Hi.  I’m Colleen Garibaldi, an artist living and working in Washington DC.  I’ve studied at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, Smithsonian Institute Studio Arts, Corcoran College of Art Continuing Ed, UDC, Cloud Farm and Virginia Tech.  My work has been exhibited in cities such as Washington, Philadelphia and Chicago and is in multiple private collections.  I'm immensely grateful that I will soon have the opportunity to work for 4 weeks at the Vermont Studio Center at an amazing residency.

For the last year I’ve been nose to the grindstone painting my heart out to create a new body of work.  But don’t worry – it’s a good grindstone! You see, I took a bit of a detour a number of years ago and got lost in a career in architecture while trying to maintain my painting practice on the side.  After years of trying to juggle both, I finally came to the realization that this dual existence just wasn’t working, so I took the leap, left my job (yes, the one with the salary) and dedicated myself solely to painting.

I dove in wholeheartedly (hence the nose-to-the-grindstone) fully understanding that I needed to create a body of work so that I could start down the path to becoming a working artist.  I'm thrilled and thankful that a major step on that path is now underway with acceptance into this residency.  I’ve included some of my recent paintings here (and a few drawings for good measure) and, as you can see, I’m a figurative artist.  This work allows me to explore the language of the body: I’m looking into reforming objectification, investigating the role of narrative in figurative work, examining patterns, pursuing clarity through distortion, wrestling with beauty, frequently endeavoring to connect with a sense of playfulness, a lightness of being and ultimately, I hope, opening the door to a greater understanding.

With your support, I can continue this exploration in Vermont. I’ll have the chance to work in a great studio (my basement is a little cramped and dark but hey, its OK if I make a mess!) and, importantly, it will give me the opportunity to work with and around other artists.  I currently work solo in my studio, and look forward to being able to work in a communal setting to learn and grow as well as to contribute however I can. Working in a like-minded community will be like a breath of fresh air – and I plan on taking many big, deep breaths! The Vermont Studio Center also gives me the opportunity to work from live models and attend lectures.  This is why I’ve been turning cartwheels! 

And so I am asking for your help to make this feasible.  Your generosity will help me defray the costs beyond the grant and work exchange of my program – funds raised will go to pay the remaining residency fees, travel costs, supplies,  photographing and shipping/transporting completed work.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping this old dog take her work to the next level.  Watch out Vermont, here I come!!

story:
The USF School of Art and Art History Graduating Class consists of 20 artists with a wide array of medium concentrations.

Painting, Drawing, Printmaking, Ceramics, Sculpture, Animation, Photography, and Film will all be proudly presented in their thesis exhibition at the Lockbox, in the heart of Downtown Tampa. 

Showing Artists Include:

Jacqueline Amick

Stephanie Arner

Savannah Austin

Jessica Barber

Jon Berdanier

Marc Bridger

Charlotte Chieco

Sarah Dyer

Sarah Ewell

Georgia Hourdas

Tasia Hron

Laura Iamiceli

Kara Lavin

Sara Miller

Justine Mobley

Jake Northrup

Clayton Petras

Christopher Serrano

Carlos Torres

Estafania Velez

This is your chance to help, as proceeds from this fundraiser will go directly into the show. By graciously donating funds, you will receive a handwritten thank you from the artists for $20. For a $50 dollar contribution, you will receive a signed limited-edition handmade poster. For a contribution of $100 or more, you will receive an original piece of artwork from one of the artists in the show. Should you wish to receive work from specific artist, please include their name in the comment box with your donation.

We thank you and truly appreciate your effort to make our thesis show the best it can possibly be.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

•You can spread the word out about the show.

•We are on:

Tumblr: https://www.tumblr.com/blog/non-refundable2015

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/NONREFUNDABLE2015

Instagram:  @nonrefundable2015 

Twitter: @non_refundable

•Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

Thank you!

story:
What is Sebastian?

Sebastian is a unique larger-than-life steel statue of the model Sebastian Sauvé. Taking its main inspirations from the myth of Narcissus, Charles Ray’s Boy with Frog and the Greco-Roman depictions of the youth Antinous, this project is both an exploration of contemporary representations of the masculine form and a comment on the icon and its place in contemporary culture. Alongside the finished stainless steel statue, which will stand over 8 feet tall, a number of smaller identical limited edition versions are being produced. Once complete, the full-size statue will be exhibited internationally before finding a permanent home. The image below shows you what the finished statue will look like.

What We Need & What You Get

Thanks to a handful of investors (really, thank you!), we've already done the first part of the project, the 3D scanning, modelling and printing/casting, and now we need to raise funds to complete the full-size statue for exhibition. In order to do that we're offering identical smaller limited edition versions of Sebastian as perks for your contribution. There's a 6 inch (15 cm) version cast in stone resin (in an edition of 50) and a 20 inch (50 cm) version cast in bronze (in an edition of 15). There's also a poster and a vest/tank top featuring the statue and some other cool stuff too, including the chance to meet the model and attend the invitation only private view in London, check out the pics below and info on the right. From the tests we've done so far we think the limited edition statues look amazing and hope you do too.

Limited edition statues

12 x 10 inch print

Vest/tank top

Original statue sketch from 2011 

The Impact

This statue will be around forever. Well, maybe not forever but for a long, long time. Given the nature of stainless steel it'll last for hundreds and hundreds of years and we hope that in the future it will become as important a work as those that have inspired it. This type of work is something that comes along once in a lifetime and we want you to be a part of making it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can make a huge difference to the success of the project by helping to spread the word. The full details of the project, all the inspirations and the process behind making it, as well as lots more images, can be found on the project website:

sebastian2012.co.uk

Please tweet it, like it and share it with your friends. Thank you!

About Stuart Sandford

Stuart Sandford received his BA Fine Art, with Honours, in 2006. He has exhibited his photographic, video and installation work in New York, London, Berlin, Basel, Rotterdam, Rome, Madrid, and Vienna, amongst others. In 2010 he curated the group show HUNG and co-curated Boy BANG Boy, both of which took place in London. His work has been featured in magazines internationally, including BUTT, GT, Maenner, Kaiserin, attitude and Objektiv, the Norwegian journal of contemporary photography.

stuartsandford.co.uk

Sebastian being scanned

About Sebastian Sauvé

American-born and British-raised Sebastian Sauvé is ranked amongst the 50 top male models in the world. His boyish yet masculine appearance coupled with a classical look is ideal for a project that not only takes its inspiration from classical sculpture but also reflects the definition of male beauty in the 21st Century.

sebastian-sauve.com

Sebastian Sauvé and Stuart Sandford

story:
I've been bringing the Soul Train to Burning Man since 2008.  I have never asked for help, I funded it myself, I maitain it myself every year.... but this year it pains me to say, this time I need help.

I took it to a mechanic, as I do every year to get it checked out... and I got some horrible news:  It needs engine and transmission work, and some electrical work.  They estimate it will cost around $3,000.  And this is not an inflated estimate, the shop I took it to is Burner friendly.

To be honest, I can't stand asking for money, I was considering simply not going to the Burn this year.  But I had too many friends convince me that I should at least put it out to the community before making that decision.  So here we are.... either I raise the money, or the Soul Train isn't coming.  Either way.... thank you for reading.

story:
Established in 2013, “The Conservation and Revitalization of Bozhou Heritage Project – The Trail Traveler” was formed by a group of Bozhou and Hong Kong artists voluntarily. This project is aimed to conserve the cultural heritage in Bozhou (CaoCao's home town), in order to strengthen the linkage between the locals and their homland, to encourage sharing of life experiences and to promote sustainable cultural business in this beautiful place so that the profound Chinese culture can be shared to everyone and at the same time imporve the livings of the locals and local artists.   

In the coming summer, we are going to hold an experimental cultural festival in Bozhou: 

 

 

*** It is not a one-time festival. We are determined to run it annually in Bozhou in future and would like to share our experimental performances and the experience of this conservation project out of Bozhou. At this initial stage, we need varies kinds of support and we hope more people can involve in it, together share our joy and excitement of this project :) ***


Caocao is one of the central figures of the Three Kingdoms period (AD 220-280). He is well-known of his military and political leadership as well as his heroic courage and manner. Caocao was born in Bozhou, and here is caocao’s experimental ground for his political and military theories. In Bozhou, Caocao had built the oldest and the most complex underground military tunnel in China. In the Cao’s Park, the domes of Caocao’s relatives, such as his grandfather, father and his eldest daughter, can be found. 

As an ancient city, there are many historical sites and ancient architectures in Bozhou, and many of them are still good in condition. Among all the sites in Bozhou, Huaqilou (Blossom opera house) is the main venue of the festival. Drama performance and exhibition will be held at here.

Huaqilou is built in 1976, during the rule of Kangxi emperor in Qing dynasty. It is a building designed for watching Chinese opera, and its name refers to the colourful paintings and vivid cravings on the blue brick walls which are less than 5 cm thick. It is recognized as a “Major Historical and Cultural Site Protected at the National Level” by the State Administration of Cultural Heritage in 1988.

 


Another heritage highlight is the Bozhou Ancient Tunnel. It is an ancient underground military tunnel built by Caocao, with its function to move his troops secretly from place to place without getting notice by his enemy. The 4 km long underground tunnel has a very complicated structure. The tunnel was constructed in a crisscross pattern and different kinds of traps were also designed to avoid enemy sneaking into the tunnel. In the ‘Records of the Three Kingdoms’, a Chinese historical text published in 3rd century, also mentioned how Caocao won the battles with the aid of this underground tunnel. 

 

 

 

 After meeting the local artists and authorities last year, we found that the local people do recognize and appreciate the heritage in Bozhou. They would like to further develop the local heritage and maintain a sustainable development for their homeland. However as they are lack of experience and information about heritage conservation, it is very difficult for them to carry out conservation and revitalization plans. That’s why we are here to help.

- To promote Chinese cultural and heritage

- To train up local talents through this project, in terms of arts management

- To advance cultural exchange between Hong Kong and Bozhou

- To encourage sharing, exchange and learning of art living skills

- To educate the new generation, by putting stress on the connection       between their homeland and its history


 

Cheung was trained in The Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts and received Bachelor of Fine Arts major in acting. During her studies, she has received a number of scholarships allowing her to have overseas exchange, which developed her scope of view and enhanced her personal development. 


Cheung actively explores the cultural arts activities throughout the world. She has participated in different international festivals, such as the International Children’s Festival Sibenik, Tchir Tchayan Internaitonal Festival Abakan, Russia and more. In 2013, she organized and created an exchange tour to Bozhao for culture and art skill exchange.

Cheung loves experimental performances, such as physically performance, mask and sand painting drama and etc. Her recent theatre credits include: The Twelfth night, The house of Bernarda Alba, Madam Qiu, and Serious Money. Cheung also participates in camera and dubbing: Mariage Sans Frontieres, the Blue Lake, Legend of the Guardians, 28 weeks later and Ocean Heaven.

Present projects:
Cheung has delivered drama/mime workshops and directed productions in different primary and secondary schools. She is now working for Hong Kong Repertory Theatre, education department and a freelance actress.

 

Wong was trained in Hong Kong Academy of Performing Arts, Hong Kong
Institute of Education (major in Sports Science) and Hong Kong Baptist University (major in Education Studies), received a Bachelor Degree. She had been a full time primary school teacher and artist of Hong Kong Disneyland.

 

Wong has received several recognitions for her outstanding contribution in arts education. She accessed the Hong Kong Arts Development Award twice, Merit in 2009-2010 and gold medal in 2010-2011, given by Hong Kong Arts Development Council, nomination of The Chief Executive’s Award for Teaching Excellent of Hong Kong Education Bureau 2011-2012, and Award of Outstand Arts Teacher by Hong Kong Arts Development Council in 2013.

 

Apart from arts education, Wong also actively participates in multimedia art production and theatre productions. She participate in varies production from Hong Kong Education Bureau, Hong Kong Arts Development Council, Hong Kong Federation of Drama Societies and more. Her productions include movie, TV programmes, educational short film, student projects and government promotion video. Wong’s recent theatre production includes ‘If on a winter’s night a traveler’, ‘River boy’, and ‘Journey to Inferno’.


Present projects:
Wong recently follow different masters to advance her physical performance, including Japanese Butoh Master Yukio Waguri. 

 


Born in Bozhou, Li was influenced by his family and friends and found his
interest in martial arts when he was little. In his age of 11, he was sent to ShaolinTemple in Henan to follow the great masters and study martial arts. After years of training, he entered Shaolin Temple WuShu Training Centre, represent ShaolinTemple to promote Shaolin martial arts culture in different countries and regions, including Greek, France, Singapore, Russia, Sari Lanka, Thailand and Hong Kong etc. In the recent years, Li had participated in varies arts productions and performed in varies places.

 

For Li, ‘Arts’ is to share anything related to one’s life, also to live, to love and to enjoy and appreciate everything Mother Nature gives us. To further enhance martial arts with drama and theatre production, Li founded Long Hei Zi Creative Theatre in 2008.

 

His projects (highlights):

Year

Production

Description

Showcased in

2005-2007

‘A Touch of Zen’ by U theatre

A drum performance with martial arts

France
Hong Kong  Singapore

2009

Main cast of ‘Legend of Zuoshan’

An original kung fu theatre

China
Russia

2011

‘Ten Ox Herding Pictures’ by Mobius Strit Theatre

An experimental environmental theatre with Zen

Taiwan

2012

‘Brothers of War’ by All Theatre Art Association

A theatre performance with sand paintings, martial arts and dance

Hong Kong

  

- Support the volunteer expense
   (including transportation and accommodation)

- Support the marketing campaign

- Technical support: PA systems, lighting systems, construction of the stage

- Performance expense: costume and props

- Exhibition expenses

- Rental fee

- Tutor fee for workshop giving

- We will further develop the experimental performance into a full length performance and touring at Bozhou’s heritage sites regularly, in order to promote Bozhou’s culture and the sense of heritage conservation among the local people

- We also hope that the performance can touring around different places outside Bozhou, especially Hong Kong, to let more people recognize the historical and cultural value of Bozhou

- School touring and educational workshops will be delivered to local students, to let them understand their homeland through arts

- We would love to enhance the cultural exchange between Bozhou and Hong Kong, by assisting the interested parties from Bozhou travel to Hong Kong (or from Hong Kong to Bozhou) to join different workshops and have varies arts experience.

 

- We are now organizing Bozhou field trips for schools and community centres in Hong Kong. The trips are scheduled in 2014 summer.

Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions about our project, or suggestions/ alternative supprt to our project! 

If you are interested in joining our project, we are welcome as well :)

Free Will Theatre (Hong Kong): freewilltheatre@gmail.com
Long Hei Zi Creative Theatre (Bozhou): 95414138@qq.com

After years of training, he entered Shaolin Temple WuShu Training Centre, represent ShaolinTemple to promote Shaolin martial arts culture in different countries and regions, including Greek, France, Singapore, Russia, Sari Lanka, Thailand and Hong Kong etc. In the recent years, Li had participated in varies arts productions and performed in varies places.
 
For Li, ‘Arts’ is to share anything related to one’s life, also to live, to love and to enjoy and appreciate everything Mother Nature gives us. To further enhance martial arts with drama and theatre production, Li founded Long Hei Zi Creative Theatre in 2008.
 
His projects (highlights):




Year


Production


Description


Showcased in




2005-2007


‘A Touch of Zen’ by U theatre


A drum performance with martial arts


FranceHong Kong  Singapore




2009


Main cast of ‘Legend of Zuoshan’


An original kung fu theatre


ChinaRussia




2011


‘Ten Ox Herding Pictures’ by Mobius Strit Theatre


An experimental environmental theatre with Zen


Taiwan




2012


‘Brothers of War’ by All Theatre Art Association


A theatre performance with sand paintings, martial arts and dance


Hong Kong




  
- Support the volunteer expense    (including transportation and accommodation)
- Support the marketing campaign
- Technical support: PA systems, lighting systems, construction of the stage
- Performance expense: costume and props
- Exhibition expenses
- Rental fee
- Tutor fee for workshop giving

- We will further develop the experimental performance into a full length performance and touring at Bozhou’s heritage sites regularly, in order to promote Bozhou’s culture and the sense of heritage conservation among the local people
- We also hope that the performance can touring around different places outside Bozhou, especially Hong Kong, to let more people recognize the historical and cultural value of Bozhou  - School touring and educational workshops will be delivered to local students, to let them understand their homeland through arts  - We would love to enhance the cultural exchange between Bozhou and Hong Kong, by assisting the interested parties from Bozhou travel to Hong Kong (or from Hong Kong to Bozhou) to join different workshops and have varies arts experience.
 
- We are now organizing Bozhou field trips for schools and community centres in Hong Kong. The trips are scheduled in 2014 summer.

Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions about our project, or suggestions/ alternative supprt to our project!  If you are interested in joining our project, we are welcome as well :)
Free Will Theatre (Hong Kong): freewilltheatre@gmail.com Long Hei Zi Creative Theatre (Bozhou): 95414138@qq.com

story:
The opening of My Friend the Foreigner is on the 22 of September in Edinburgh, Scotland.  
With this exchange exhibition project we want to create a vibrant dialog between two cities; Edinburgh and Reykjavik. We have come to see that there is no current artistic link between these two cities and we believe that it would make an interesting exchange in dialogue in the field of visual art, to open a link for discussion & interaction and possibly some collaborative work in the near future.

The exhibition should represent contemporary art today in Reykjavik and Edinburgh.

The Old Ambulance Depot has offered five Icelandic artists an opportunity  to be exhibited now in September 2011. The opening of the exhibition is on the 22 of September at 17.00 and everyone is welcome. The Old Ambulance Depot is becoming a very prominent exhibition venue for new and emerging artists.
The Ambulance depot is positioned in the heart of Edinburgh and has featured shows as Blurred Boundaries http://www.theedinburghreporter.co.uk and the solo show of Kevin Harman Mesomorphic http://welcometohr.com/2011/03/20/mesomorphic-2/.
Artists and art enthusiasts have become very much acquainted with the venue and a reputation for good exhibitions has evolved around the exhibition space. The exhibition will be open from 12.00 to 17.00 until the 25 of September,the artists will be there every day and performances will be take place everyday at 14.00 and 16.00. On the 25 of September the artists will host a talk where they will introduce themselves and their practice. This will be open to everyone. The artists from Edinburgh will welcome the group and be the main link to the art environment in Edinburgh.

With this exhibition project we want to open up to a dialog between young emerging artists from Iceland and the UK if possible. It is very important to offer young emerging artists the opportunity to exhibit their work abroad and if possible with this kind of exhibition exchange projects and make new and vibrant grounds for communication between artists and art lovers.
It will open up new possibilities for collaborations and connections between the two countries, the two cities.

We have tried to find funding for this project but it has not fully succeeded and the opening is in seven days. We need more money to fully fund the costs and the expenses for the exhibition in Edinburgh. Your support would be very appreciated. In return we want to create a one off art piece for everyone who will donate $100 or more. We will create the piece together during the opening in Edinburgh at the Old Ambulance Depot. This is a great opportunity to get an original art work by 5 emerging Icelandic artists.
On the Monday the 26 of September 2011 we will send the art work to everyone who donate $100 or more signed by all the five artists.

Please share this campaign with everyone & anyone, or who you think would like to support this exhibition. Thank you very much - and we hope to see you in  Edinburgh or in Iceland in the future !!!
About the Icelandic artist:
http://myfriendtheforeigner.tumblr.com/

story:
Our Story

I am a struggling artist living in the beautiful countryside of Oconee County, Georgia. Unlike many artists who have a second income, I have none due to numerous health problems. I spend most of my time at home, creating my art, looking after my teenage daughter, and trying to keep my health in check. I have zero income and make very little from my art in this economy. But that's okay. All I want is to be able to keep creating my art.


I have a huge collection of blank Artist Trading Cards (like the pack shown right). With your subscription I will send you 1 Art Card a month for an entire year! This will be an original watercolor painting, measuring 2.5 x 3.5 inches. It will come housed in a clear, protective sleeve. A 1 year subscription costs only $20.00.


Once you subscription begins you can expect to receive the first art card in about a week (US Subscribers), included will be your coupon code for Etsy. International subscribers should expect their art card in approx. 10-14 days.


The Impact

With your subscription I will be able to buy new supplies and tools I desperately need and have no way of buying in the immediate future. It will mean I can keep creating and sharing my art


What I Need & What You Get

I need $800.00. 


1. My laptop is not doing as well as it once did. I use my laptop for editing photos of artwork, selling online at Etsy, and even creating digital art. If I lose my laptop, I lose my lifeline. I want to buy a refurbished laptop for $390.00.


2. The camera that I photograph my artwork with has begun to flip out on me. I spend hours trying to get a good picture. I want to buy a new camera for $200.00


3. I would like to spend $150.00 to help stock up on art supplies--paints, a real easel, new brushes (not the cheap ones that fall apart after a couple weeks), etc.


4. The remainder I'd like to invest in my Etsy Shop, Nature's Charms. I want to transform it into a business, a successful selling shop.


If I only make part of my goal I'll use some of it for art supplies and put the rest in savings for a laptop. I must have the laptop if I want to continue selling online.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone!! If each person shared with their friends, and their friends shared with their friends, I know we can make this happen.

story:
My name is David Lavernia, also known as, DaveL. I am a full-time visual artist living and working in the sunny city of Miami, FL. Art is not only my hobby but my calling and true passion in life. It has brought me immeasurable joy and I would love to share that joy with the world.

I plan on taking a 40 day art road trip throughout the United States with Nik Martinez, a professional photographer I have worked with several times. We’ve decided on stopping in about 15 cities in 15 states for pop up art shows and live paintings. Along the way, we will also be visiting children's hospitals and other interested institutions to offer either a free mural or to paint with children. I would like to brighten up everyday life and give back something that has given me everything. I believe this project will influence and engage young minds. I also believe that this project will encourage communities to continue to support events like these.

With the help of friends and sponsors this can all come true. We will need sufficient funding for 40 days of travel. All donations will go directly to helping us on our journey. With each contribution there will be a nice perk in return. Depending on the amount donated you will receive an item from the following: original art print, original framed pen & ink drawing, original medium sized painting or an original large scale painting/3D cutout painting. Upon our return we will be making a book out of our adventure from all the beautiful photos Nik will shoot.

I cannot thank you enough for taking the time to read through my campaign. If you are not able to donate you can still help by sharing this page with your friends and colleagues.

Below is my tentative itinerary. If you know of any events that are already scheduled on these days please do not hesitate to contact me about them. I would love to join forces with artists!

10/1 - Jacksonville, FL.
10/2 - 10/3 - Charleston, SC.
10/4 - 10/5 - Philadelphia, PA.
10/6 - 10/7 - Brooklyn, NY.
10/8 - 10/9 - Boston, MA.
10/10-10/12 - Columbus, OH.
10/13 - Louisville, KY.
10/15 - 10/17 - Denver, CO.
10/19-10/20 - Seattle, WA.
10/21 - Portland, OR.
10/23-10/25 - San Francisco & Oakland, CA.
10/26-10/31 - Los Angeles & San Diego CA.
11/2 - Phoenix, AZ.
11/3 - Austin, TX.
11/4 - 11/5 - New Orleans, LA.
11/6 - Orlando, FL.
11/8 - Miami (Home Base)


A very special thank you goes out to all of my sponsors!

*ZICO Coconut Water

*FRANKLEIDOSCOPE

*BC Surf + Sport

*Billabong

*ALL OF MY PEERS!

story:
IIt seems I'm forever asked where I get my ideas for jewelry and structures. Art & Inspiration, a coffee table memoir, was written to answer that question. Last April, on a  three week, 7,500 + mile marketing trip, (my collaborative author who happens to be my mother Diane Elliott, an award winning author) and I wrote two thirds of this book. Back home, photographer and grant writer Linda Mitchell Griffith agreed to photograph the pieces for the book as well as design the layout.

As a jewelry artist and registered architect (licensed in two states and LEED Accredited Professional), my hands and my eyes are the most important assets I own. In 2001 I was first diagnosed with age-related macular degeneration (AMD). I didn't pay attention because the doctor said, "it will be years before you have anything to worry about." In fact I'd forgotten about it. Nine years later I changed eye doctors and this doctor was horrified that I was doing nothing for my AMD. He sent me to a retina specialist and she mapped my eyes. The macula in both eyes showed drusen, but being the dry type, she could do nothing. I told my mother and son about it. Mother began to cry. My son held her tight putting everything in perspective by saying, "Amah, it's her sight, not her mind."

Eventually I found AMD.org,  Macular Degeneration Partnership, and discovered several things I could do to help slow the progress of AMD. I signed up for their newsleter to keep abreast of research and clinical trials that they monitor. I found a wealth of information on what I can do now as well as what might be in store for me in my future. After my second diagnosis, I knew I wanted to create as much as I could in the sighted years I have left. Even then I had the urge to do something to further research on macular degeneration.

In trials, Fenretinide looked promising as a dry AMD treatment. This may never come to market due to lack of research funding. Our eventual goal is to raise funds through the sale and promotion of this book to advance research into AMD.



Never Lose Sight! By Linda Mitchell Griffith

If you were to ask yourself "Which of my five senses would I most hate to lose? Hearing? Touch? Smell? Taste? Sight?" You would most likely answer, "My sight." That's what the vast majority of people have replied in various national and international surveys. According to a recent poll, Americans fear blindness more than any other disability. As we age, the chance of developing an eye disease increases dramatically. Macular degeneration is an incurable eye disease that is the leading cause of blindness for those 55 and older in the United States. It affects more than 15 million Americans. As our population ages, the incidence of this disease is expected to explode in numbers.

 

Macular degeneration is caused by the deterioration of the central portion of the retina, the inside back layer of the eye that records the images we see and sends them to the brain. Macular degeneration limits or completely destroys our ability to read, drive a car, recognize faces or colors, safely navigate stairs, or see objects in fine detail. Unfortunately, the cause of macular degeneration is not completely understood and research is limited by insufficient funding.

 

For an artist, the diagnosis of macular degeneration is devastating and overwhelmingly life-changing. Souther has been living with a diagnosis of macular degeneration since 2001. That is why she has decided to donate 100 percent of the profits of her book to the research into this dread condition. Souther and her friends have donated all their time and talents needed to make this book a reality. The costs they must cover are for the printing and promotion of the book.

 

According to AMD.org, a non profit corporation that is committed to improving research and methods of treatment for those impaired by macular degeneration, cutbacks in federal funding for medical research make it necessary to reach out for funding from the private sector. Souther wants her book to benefit this outstanding organization. AMD.org‘s research could make the difference in the lives of people who have, or will have, macular degeneration. Your partnership in this book will help provide assistance needed to save the precious sight of millions of our fellow human beings.



ART & INSPIRATION is scheduled to come out winter 2012.

As I travel the United States promoting this book and raising funds for AMD research I will keep followers updated on Facebook about fundraising milestones and dollars sent to AMD.org.


WHERE THE INDIEGOGO FUNDS WILL GO: Our goal is to raise enough money for the printing and binding of our first edition. The finished book will be a jacketed 7" x 9", 4 color print, on 100 pound acid-free matte paper. This project will be Smyth sewn with a hard cover using standard cloth and foil. It promises to be a beautiful presentation. If additional funds are raised they will be allocated to:

  • web site development
  • narrative CDs (especially useful for the visually limited)
  • envelopes, packing materials, postage more books - the first 2500 are much more expensive than the next 2500 if ordered together


HELP THIS PROJECT SEE THE LIGHT OF DAY

If you are able to pledge or better yet want to pre-order your copy and receive your book earlier than anyone else, a greater portion of your contribution will fund macular degeneration research than if we had gone with a traditional publishing venue. You can increase those funds by letting others know about this project.

Email your friends asking them to check out this Indiegogo project.
Share this Indigogo project on your Facebook timeline or Twitter
Like us on Facedbook http://www.facebook.com/artandinspiration
Feel free to post any additional questions or comments on http://www.facebook.com/artandinspiration or e-mail souther@outonabead.com

Thank you for your time and attention to this project. Together we can make a difference.

story:
The Lowly Ginger Printer, Bethany C. Rahn, has been offered an internship at the glorious Hatch Show Print in Nashville, Tenn. for Fall 2012 and now needs your support to make her dreams reality. 

She is asking for $5500. Here is what your support will do:

-Moving. Hatch Show Print has offered Rahn an extensive unpaid letterpress internship where she will learn and be exposed to high volume printing by some of the top designers and printers in the United States. This means Rahn will be moving 600 miles away from Madison, Wis. to Nashville, Tenn.

-Documenting. Rahn plans to document the entire journey via film, photos and blog postings to keep everyone updated on this exciting journey. 

-Living expenses. Since the internship is unpaid Rahn hopes to obtain a part-time job while in Nashville. However, your contribution will help ensure her financial stability during the internship. 

All perks are created specifically for this campaign!

More about me? Please visit my blog, youtube channel and the Rahn For Hatch 2012 Facebook Page.

This funding is not connected to Hatch Show Print or the Country Music Hall of Fame, but solely helps support The Lowly Ginger Printer through this fantastic transition.

story:
smArtAction is a collaborative art exhibition organized by a group of University of Puerto Rico and New York based student-activists. smArtAction's mission is to provide a platform for artistic expression and continuous dialogue; engage students, organizers, and artists in current issues of higher education, while building a network of socially engaged students.

Through the interaction with art, we hope to challenge ways of thinking about educational rights and stimulate long-lasting discussions about the future of education.

We are deeply passionate about Art, the key role that it plays within a community and the ability to create social transformation. The exhibition will serve as a space to engage in conversations regarding Puerto Rico’s social and political status as it relates to the rest of the United States and beyond.

The exhibition will be hosted by El Puente, Brooklyn and Hostos Community College in the Bronx, October/November 2012.

With your support we’ll be able to fund:

  • Workshops for the community
  • Stipend for Art Handler
  • Costs for shipping the artwork from New York to Puerto Rico
  • Travel expenses for Puerto Rican artist to conduct artistic workshops for  communities

 

SUPPORT US!

Find more information:

www.smartactionexhibition.com

http://www.facebook.com/smartactionexhibition

@smartactionex

-------

 

smArtAction es una exposición colectiva de arte realizada por un grupo de estudiantes activistas de la Universidad de Puerto Rico y la Universidad de Nueva York. La misión smArtAction es proporcionar una plataforma para la expresión artística y el diálogo continuo, involucrar a los estudiantes, organizadores y artistas en los problemas actuales de la educación superior, generando una red de estudiantes socialmente comprometidos.

A través de la interacción con el arte, esperamos desafiar la manera de pensar acerca de los derechos educativos y estimular una discusión permanente sobre el futuro de la educación.

Estamos profundamente apasionado por el arte, el papel fundamental que desempeña dentro de una comunidad y la capacidad de crear una transformación social. Esta exposición servirá como un espacio para participar en conversaciones sobre el estatus social y político de Puerto Rico, su relación con el resto de los Estados Unidos y más allá.

La exposición tendrá en El Puente, Brooklyn y Hostos College en Octubre/Noviembr 2012

Con su colaboracion seremos capaces de financiar:

  • Talleres para la comunidad
  • Estipendio para controlador de Arte
  • Los costos de envío de la parte posterior obra de arte de Nueva York a Puerto Rico
  • Los gastos de viaje de Puerto Rico artista para llevar a cabo talleres artísticos para la comunidad

 

APOYANOS!

Para mayor información:

www.smartactionexhibition.com

http://www.facebook.com/smartactionexhibition

@smartactionex
story_txt:
smArtAction is a collaborative art exhibition organized by a group of University of Puerto Rico and New York based student-activists. smArtAction's mission is to provide a platform for artistic expression and continuous dialogue; engage students, organizers, and artists in current issues of higher education, while building a network of socially engaged students.
Through the interaction with art, we hope to challenge ways of thinking about educational rights and stimulate long-lasting discussions about the future of education.
We are deeply passionate about Art, the key role that it plays within a community and the ability to create social transformation. The exhibition will serve as a space to engage in conversations regarding Puerto Rico’s social and political status as it relates to the rest of the United States and beyond.
The exhibition will be hosted by El Puente, Brooklyn and Hostos Community College in the Bronx, October/November 2012.
With your support we’ll be able to fund:

Workshops for the community
Stipend for Art Handler
Costs for shipping the artwork from New York to Puerto Rico
Travel expenses for Puerto Rican artist to conduct artistic workshops for  communities
 
SUPPORT US!
Find more information:
www.smartactionexhibition.com
http://www.facebook.com/smartactionexhibition
@smartactionex

story:
SUDINmagazine explores contemporary art from a new perspective—21st century Jewish identity. By not being confined by geographic or political boundaries, Jewish culture can engage the globalized world in especially relevant ways. Contributors from around the world participate in the conversation. They each lend unique insights and experience, but they are united by their strong 21st century Jewish identity.

Through SUDINmagazine, readers who pride themselves on the depth of their engagement with the art and culture of the city around them have access to some of the most intriguing and exciting work of the year. Readers who are deeply invested in the life of their Jewish communities come to SUDINmagazine because they care about what happens when Jewish artists take a look at themselves, and then turn their gaze outward.


Use of Funds

6″×9″ printed book featuring over 100 pages of full color images from Jewish artists and designers from around the world

Beyond 5,000? Launching the website and purchasing equipment to produce Jewish art programming.

Premiering 5771/2011


If you would like to contribute by check, please follow instructions here.

story:
What's this all about?

I was very recently selected to be part of Raw Boston's August art event "Radiate" (http://www.rawartists.org/boston/radiate) and it's an incredible opportunity to get my work in front of a lot of people and potentially actually SELL some. But times are hard and I'm pretty broke so I don't really have the funds to put out for prints and books that MIGHT sell. That's why I need your help.

Where's my money going?

All of your funding will go to prints, frames, books or transport costs. With enough money I think I can really come in and make the kind of impact I think my work deserves. This is a flexible funding campaign because I can use all you can give me. Thank you so much in advance.

How else can I help?

If you're IN the Boston area on August 9th, please come check it out. You can buy advance tickets here: http://www.rawartists.org/boston/radiate/?artist=68764

story:
Local crafting duo Midtown Dreamers - who make goods out of old vinyl records -  are teaming up with the Gorillaknitting Crew - a local art crew who does, well...everything - to hold Trip City, a 2nd Saturday show, to raise funds for Vox Sacramento on June 9, 2012.

Vox Sacramento is a nonprofit organization that is runentirely by volunteers. They teach free art classes for children and low-cost classes for adults. They also operate as an art gallery where artists who are trying to make a break in the art world can show their work. Additionally, they hold workshops and lectures for students and artists alike.

Trip City will feature all sorts of local artists from Sacramento. We will have a skateboarding ramp and will be offering free skateboarding lessons and performing demonstrations. We are proud to announce that we will have live music from local bands and MC’s. There will be live painting demonstrations by local street artists and we are currently looking for a few local break dancers that are willing to teach a small lesson to our young community members. Everyone that is a part of this event will be volunteering their time and effort to make this event possible.

Since Vox is a nonprofit organization, we are asking our community members for any kind of gift donation, cash donation, gift card, membership, food, time, art, etc. Any kind of donation will help us out tremendously! We will be holding a raffle the day of the 2nd Saturday event and all proceeds from the raffle will be given back to Vox Sacramento. We are also looking for volunteers to help with the event and we are in need of food and beverages.   

Please let us know if you are interested in helping us raise money for this wonderful non-profit program Vox Sacramento, by either donating or volunteering. If you are interested, your name or your business's name and address will be printed on our flyer and you will definitely be mentioned at our event.

Feel free to stop by on June 9 from 4-9 p.m. or anytime just to check out the place.
Vox, 1818 11th St.
You can also check them out on line www.voxsac.com

The coordinator of this event is Amanda Branham you can get a hold of her at (916)747-0998 or e-mail her at amanda.branham82@gmail.com if you have any questions or would like to participate in any way shape or form.
We will be wrapping up all donations on June 2 but you are welcome to donate directly to Vox at www.voxsac.com anytime.

story:
Danielle has exhibited "Signs of the Times: A Single Lady's Life in Neon"  twice inside North Carolina with a reception that has been both amazing and humbling. She has now been asked to exhibit her work in an upcoming neon exhibition in San Francisco. "She Bends 2: Women in Neon" will be opening at The Midway (www.themidwaysf.com) in San Francisco on March 24th. (SUPER SOON) However, the logistics of getting her work across the country for her West Coast debut have proven expensive. The week of March 20th Danielle will be driving her very fragile neon artwork across the United States in order to exhibit in this exciting show with her fellow female neon artists. Using Route 66 as inspiration most of her artistic career, Danielle is planning on using this trip as an opportunity to document the neon signs and roadside attractions along the way for future work.  This 2 week-long trip back and forth along I-40 west will be rewarding, stressful, and exciting, but most of all it will be expensive. 

Can you help an artist out? Any little bit helps a lot with gas and a place to stay. And in return, you'll get a little piece of Danielle's art to keep for yourself! She will be producing a variety of stickers, postcards, and art prints to thank anyone who donates to the travel fund. And who doesn't like swag?

Thanks in advance for supporting my trip, my work, and my obsession with this medium. You're helping my glowing, neon dreams come true.

Cheers, DJ Neon

story:
CAFKA.14: 

It Should Always Be This Way

May 31 - June 29, 2014

OUR STORY

CAFKA organizes an exhibition of art in the public spaces of the Waterloo Region every two years.

That’s the CAFKA biennial.

It’s beautiful. It’s meaningful. It’s humorous.

If you haven’t seen it before, we know it will blow you away.

The art is installed in the streets, parks, storefronts and public atriums, mostly in downtown Kitchener and also in Cambridge and Waterloo. It’s public art, it’s free and it’s for everyone.

This year, the month-long biennial includes sixteen projects and opens on May 31, 2014. This will be CAFKA’s ninth ambitious exhibition. It’s called It Should Always Be This Way. We like to think of it as a utopian dream.

The CAFKA biennial is a moving testament to ingenuity. It challenges us to look deeper and, while we’re there, to think, express wonder and, quite often, laugh.

CAFKA is an artist-run organization. We bring artists from all over the world and pay them well for their work.

Like just about any small arts organization, we are short of funds. In fact, we need to raise $20,000 to meet the total biennial budget of $95,000.

Raising $20,000?

That’s 200 people donating $100.
That’s 400 people donating $50.

Are there 200 people out there who can give $100 to keep this dream alive? Are there 400 people who can give $50?

We hope there are.



All funds raised support installation costs for 16 projects, including building costs, artist fees & materials, travel, accommodation, administration and marketing expenses for the CAFKA 14 biennial exhibition.


Cultural events like this one have never mattered more to Waterloo Region, especially in downtown Kitchener, where people are working so hard, transforming the town. CAFKA is a piece of that puzzle and it’s something we can be proud of. But it's pretty hard to do it alone.
We need you to become a stakeholder in CAFKA, and help us create something amazing.


By supporting CAFKA, you are contributing to a thriving, vibrant cultural life in Kitchener and Waterloo Region.

Please, please donate if you can! 

Help us spread the word by sharing this campaign with your network.

Thank you!



CAFKA.14 Artist Projects:

1. Ann Marie Hadcock (Wiarton, ON), Dream of an Oasis. Ann Marie Hadcock rejuvenates a dead tree by covering it in chenille to create the illusion of a snow covered tree.

2. SWINTAK (Toronto, ON), The Gallows is a performance where the artist will sleep on a roaming bed that will roll and float throughout Kitchener and Waterloo. 

3. Dagmara Genda (Guelph, ON), a really really big doodle! is a giant doodle printed on removable adhesive vinyl and installed on the windows of the Charles & Benton parkade in Kitchener. The inspiration for the doodle is drawn from the surrounding environment of the parked.

4. Darren Copeland & Andreas Kahre (Toronto, ON & Vancouver, BC), SITCOM, is an interactive bench that plays locally recorded and edited sounds from nature (i.e. underwater recordings of Grand River) and human interactions (i.e. people talking). Sounds are triggered by sitting on the surface of the bench.

5. Bruno Martelli & Ruth Gibson (London, UK), In Search of Abandoned is an interactive computer generated world that allows viewers to see and experience a non-place nestled amongst the archipelago of the Arctic Circle. The work will be presented in the Communitech Hub’s Interactive Virtual Environment. 

6. Jefferson Campbell-Cooper (Hillsburg, ON), Contricycles are two tractor trailer replicas (a backhoe and a front-end loader) and a water truck constructed from salvaged bicycle parts. Vehicles are operated by pedal power to move modest amount of materials.

7. Krzysztof Wodiczko (New York, NY), will undertake a projection mapping project featuring voices and video images of the community projected on the statue of Queen Victoria in Victoria Park.


8. Laura Moore (Toronto, ON), One Man's Junk is three computer monitors carved to scale from limestone.


9. Mary Mattingly (New York, NY), House and Universe: Sphere and Cube is two sculptures - a large sphere and a large cube, consisting of the artist’s personal possessions bound together with rope. On June 21st the artist will roll her boulder of personal possessions along King Street from Kitchener City Hall to Waterloo Public Square.


10. Nova Jiang (Los Angeles, CA), Ideogenetic Machine is a digital interactive installation that produces live comic book story-boarding. The software created by the artist incorporates portraits of the audience into an algorithmically generated comic book.


11. Robert Hengeveld (Toronto, ON), Rotating Tree is a rotating deciduous tree installed in the park.


12. Samuel Roy-Bois (Vancouver, BC), The Tower is a car collision with a 21 ft. high rise building model.

13. Sara Graham (Vancouver, BC), Pype Supersystem is three yellow pipe sculptures installed around Kitchener and Waterloo, made with the assistance of City of Kitchener hydro and gas department.


14. Don Miller (Shelburne, ON) will transform two abandoned houses in downtown Kitchener. 


15. Seripop (Montreal, QC) will create a large immersive screen-printed paper installation that responds to existing architecture and public spaces within Kitchener.


16. Steve Lambert (New York, NY), Public Forum is a retro-inspired commercial sign that will display statements from members of the community; passers-by will be invited to vote whether statements are true or false.


CAFKA.14 is supported by the City of Kitchener, Kitchener and Waterloo Community Foundation: Musagetes Fund, Scribblers' Club, Canada Council for the Arts, Ontario Arts Council, Christie Digital and Revel Development.


CAFKA is also supported by many talented volunteers who program and install the work, provide educational programs to school groups and the public, and throw legendary opening parties. We'd love for you to get involved and volunteer with CAFKA. Please get in touch.


The CAFKA.14 opening party is taking place on May 31 in a beautiful old building at the corner of King & Queen in downtown Kitchener. CAFKA sponsor Revel Development is transforming the 2nd & 3rd floors of the building into open concept offices. Before the new tenants move in, Revel and CAFKA are throwing the opening party there. Food, drinks, DJs and projections of the CAFKA.14 installations with the CAFKA.14 artists in attendance will make for a fabulous evening.

CAFKA.14
Contemporary Art In The Public Space
May 31-June 29, 2014


"It Should Always Be This Way"


The CAFKA.14 theme: It Should Always Be This Way was inspired by Marcel O'Gorman and reflects Cafka's belief that during the biennial, people's daily business is disrupted by the presence of "objects-to-think-with" positioned throughout the city. Rather than putting our heads down and rushing toward our destinations, we may turn our heads sideways and upwards, turn toward contemplation and curiosity, turn toward the artworks and then toward each other in conversation. 


Contemplation and curiosity are vanishing skills in our culture of distraction and efficiency, of handheld devices and online interactions. We have shifted from an information economy to an attention economy, subjected daily to psychotechnologies and neuromarketing. CAFKA has the capacity to disrupt this economy, or perhaps to engage directly in it, by capturing the attention of the city for a few short weeks. People should always be prompted to turn their heads sideways for the sake of contemplation, curiosity, and conversation. "It should always be this way."

Walter van Broekhuizen, The Green Room, CAFKA.11: SURVIVE. RESIST. Photo: Walter van Broekhuizen.


Contemporary art attracts people who are delighted by the new and who thrive on contemplating deeper meanings and connections. If you are reading this you are probably one of those people. Cheers.

story:
Campaña apoyada por Vera Benavente (aunque es una iniciativa "popular") 

Vera Benavente es una persona que muestra una gran sensibilidad artística, es fotógrafa y filósofa, y sería muy bonito que pudiera viajar a Atenas el día del referéndum sobre la continuidad de los planes de austeridad en Grecia.

Se prevé un resultado histórico, un día que lo cambiará todo, las emociones estarán a flor de piel y Vera captará la esencia, en imágenes y en palabras.
story_txt: Campaña apoyada por Vera Benavente (aunque es una iniciativa "popular") Vera Benavente es una persona que muestra una gran sensibilidad artística, es fotógrafa y filósofa, y sería muy bonito que pudiera viajar a Atenas el día del referéndum sobre la continuidad de los planes de austeridad en Grecia. story:
Hi!

We're Kyle and Dustin, two passionate design students from Ohio who love traveling.  We're planning a motorcycle trip across Southeastern Asia in August and September, but we need some help!  While on our trip we will be documenting our travels with some beautiful photos and paintings, and we would love it if you would buy some of them in advance so we could go!  

We’re passionate about people, nature, culture, and art.  This trip will fuel those passions and teach us incredible things about the world we live in.  We’ll each be keeping blogs while we’re abroad so be sure to follow us and keep updated!  By funding our campaign you’ll not only get a personalized piece of art from our trip, but you’ll be an integral part of making our dream become a reality. 

Dustin's Blog

Kyle's Blog

Where is your money going?

Your contribution will help us pay for our plane tickets to Vietnam, rent two mopeds, lodging, and food.  The total costs come to slightly over $6,000 for two people.

What will I get for funding your campaign?

You will get a piece of memorabilia from our trip!  You can choose between personalized travel advice, one of Kyle’s paintings (varying sizes available), one of Dustin’s photographs printed on canvas (varying sizes available), or even an art book containing both photographs and paintings from our trip.  If you want, we’ll even take one of your toys or stuffed animals with us and document his adventures in a personalized art book!  (Don’t worry, we’ll keep him safe and send him back as good as new!)

That’s all nice, but why should I fund your campaign?

Great question!  Through this project we will meet incredible people and see amazing things.  As designers, everything that we do is informed by our life experience.  This trip will put us in a better position to create designs that are more than just superficial junk, but things that will benefit the world that we know and love.  If you fund our campaign we will always be grateful to you for the significant role that you will have played in our lives. 

Risks & Challenges

The greatest obstacle that we face in making this trip a reality is money, which is where you can help us out!  Anything helps, even just a small donation and our appreciation and gratitude for your help is limitless.

How else can I help?

We need all the help we can get, and a large part of that is getting the word out.  Share our campaign on social media and we’ll give you a shout out on our blogs while we’re abroad!

Below are some examples of Dustin’s photography and Kyle’s paintings.  You can find more under the gallery tab of our campaign.

Thank You!

Here are some of Kyle's paintings!

We'll even take pictures of your stuffed animal/toy abroad and send you an art book of the pictures if you want!

If you want to see more images of our work please look in the "Gallery" tab of our campaign above.

Thank you for your support!
