story:
Short Summary

My name is CHAD. I am 38 years old, I have never been married and I have no children.
I have lived in Indianapolis, IN and have been creating original paintings the past 14 years.
I have created well over 1,000 paintings during this time.
I gave hundreds of paintings away the first few years.
I have been selling my paintings for the past 7 years through eBay, local establishments, and word of mouth.
I am a true "outsider".
I have never had a gallery show or been a part of the "art scene".
I am self-taught and have studied modern art from Fauvism, to current street art.
I have charged very little for my paintings in order to get them out into the world.
Over 500 paintings can be found in homes across 35 states, 3 countries, and very many here in Indianapolis.
Bottom line, I have created a very large body of work, but have sacrificed any kind of stability in my personal life.
I am currently broke, without employment, without a phone, without a car, and without a place to live.
I am fortunate to have a friend that has allowed me to stay in the basement of his house for the next few weeks.  

NOW WAIT!!! Before you think to yourself, "what a loser" and hit stop, please let me show you some examples of my paintings. (refer to video)

Now you may ask, "With a body of work that large, how did this guy end up in this position?"
Well, 8 years ago I left a very successful career in Logistics to focus on my artwork and to become a full time artist.
That did not happen like I thought it would.
People in the "art world" do not always take self-taught outside artists very seriously.
I have had various jobs during the past 8 years in order to pay the bills.
I have sold cars, did temp work, and even worked at a pharmaceutical company.
The past 4 years I have worked at a local restaurant.
That job recently ended.

Now it's time for a change.
That change is moving to New Orleans, LA.
I lived in New Orleans for about 6 months way back in 2000.
This experience is what inspired me to start painting when I moved back to Indianapolis for what I thought was going to be my career in Logistics.
Now I would like to return to the BIG EASY to try and re-capture that inspiration.
I feel that I have had a good go at trying to make it as an artist in Indianapolis the past 14 years.
I have been very fortunate to be able to sell my work here on the eastside.
I have also had the opportunity to create artwork for local musicians.
None of this however has enabled me to create art full time.
I am now ready for a change of pace, scenery, and development.

Why New Orleans?
New Orleans is a vibrant city, with a rich history.
The cost of living is not extremely high and with public transportation and the trolley system, you can get around without a vehicle.
Inspiration can be found in the music, food, people, and architecture.
This is the inspiration I am seeking.
There isn't the level of pretentiousness in New Orleans that seems to exist in other major cities when it comes to art.
At the end of this campaign I am planning on taking a Greyhound bus from Indianapolis to New Orleans.
I will only be taking a duffle bag and a backpack with me.


What I Need & What You Get

Now, what do I need?
I am asking for donations to fund my relocation.  
At the time of this video I have not found a room to rent yet, but will be doing so while this campaign is going on.
I am trying to procure enough money to pay for:
Deposit and first two months rent for a place to live.
Bus ticket from Indianapolis to New Orleans.
Food for 2 months.
A very cheap phone (to help me find a job).
A small amount of art supplies
And a small cushion for "just in case".

Please know that I am not looking for a free vacation here.
I truly am trying to further my artistic style and become a full time artist.
You can help me do that.
Now I understand that this is not what "crowd-funding" is normally for.
I am asking for an investment in ME.

What do you get for investing in a true outside artist?
Once in New Orleans I will be seeking employment of some sort, but I will be getting right back to work on my paintings, only it will be in a new environment with new inspirations.
For a $10 donation you will receive a handwritten thank you letter and drawing from me.
For a $25 donation you will receive an original abstract watercolor piece.
For a $100 donation you will receive 10" x 10" original acrylic on canvas abstract painting.
And for a $200 donation you will receive a 20" x 16" original acrylic on canvas abstract painting.
I am planning on these original pieces to be the foundation for my next era of paintings.
You will be getting the very first ones!

The Impact

This is certainly a life-changing event for me.
I have given everything away in order to make art.
At 38 years old I have a drive and determination for this and I will pursue becoming a full time artist until I die.

Please know that all money donated will go toward this relocation event.
I am not trying to scam or take advantage of anyone.
I am looking for help.
I will be leaving for New Orleans regardless of the outcome of this campaign, however, this campaign will be the difference between me having to hitchhike there or taking a bus and having a place to live or being homeless once I arrive.
It's just too cold to be homeless in Indianapolis during the winter.

With your donation you are helping me relocate to an amazing city, allowing me to continue this journey as an artist, and you will get an original letter, watercolor, or painting from me.

Please help a broke artist continue his creative journey.

Thank you.
CHAD.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am also selling the last of my Indianapolis based work on eBay.
You can view these here: http://tinyurl.com/o78v36b
These will only be available at these prices until this campaign ends.

story:
Short Summary

Nicole James and Michael Lane are honored to have received a grant from the JOM Indian Education Council Board to work with students at Navajo Nation Middle School in Page, Arizona. We will be transforming an existing sculpture of a Dimetrodon Dinosaur by working collaboratively to cover it with glass tiles.

Both Nicole and Michael bring a wealth of experience to this project, having worked as independent artists and educators for over 10-years. Nicole specializes in glass mosaic pieces: www.Nicolekjames.com, and Michael also works with glass mosaics, in addition to the conceptualization and execution of collaborative projects for the Des Moines Arts Festival and Des Moines Art Center: www.michael-j-lane.com.
We are seeking $1500 in matching dollars to help cover the cost of our travel expenses to Page, Arizona. Through the generous support of the Jom Indian Education Council Board, we have already been awarded the following:

$1500     Materials and supplies.
$500       Stipend to be split between both artists.

Your contribution ensures the success of the project and will reach well beyond the immediate, as projects such as these build and strengthen community, foster cooperation, and deepen a students understanding of art and art methods. Most importantly, students whom are afforded these kinds of opportunities leave with life-long memories while their accomplishments remain on public view for years to come. This is truly an exciting opportunity for students at Navajo Nation.

Thank you for your consideration, and we greatly appreciate any assistance you can provide. Please share this link with your family and friends.

story:
Space 4 Art and the San Diego Guild of Puppetry are presenting ART FUN, a free giant puppet parade for kids of all ages as part of the lunchtime festivities for during the San Diego Contemporary Art Fair. We envision the parade as a community event for children celebrating the Arts of San Diego on the downtown waterfront. The activities will take place at the Hilton Hotel Amphitheater on September 4, 2011 from 11 am to 2 pm.

 

We are asking you to help fund this exciting, multicultural, child and family centered event. Your contribution of any amount over $10 will help pay for art materials and mentoring by professional artist/puppeteers for children and their families, many of whom have had little or no exposure to the arts. We envision up to 100 parade participants attending a series of pre-parade workshops, creating masks, banners, and puppets then bringing them to life in a joyful, drum-led pageant on parade day, celebrating the power of the arts to bring us all together.

 

All participants will benefit tremendously from your generosity and your support will enable us to begin a new tradition with this inaugural San Diego ART FUN Giant Puppet Parade. 

 

Don’t rain on our parade—Please share this with your friends and family, and please come out on September 4th to join the fun! 


Cheryl Nickel, Founder, Space 4 Art  

sdspace4art.org                           

 

Lynne Jennings, President, San Diego Guild of Puppetry           

sandiegoguildofpuppetry.org

 

Barbara Gothard, Volunteer Organizer

story:
my agenda

Hello Friends!
  • For those of you that do and don't know me, I am the visionary and driving force behind the east coast, third wave, industrial rock band The Clay People. For 25 years I have helped my local and national scene move forward. I am an artist before a musician, therefore I have been behind promoting and executing shows and showcasing, music and art in my area. Either through booking art shows, djn, music showcases, and charity events. I always put my peers first, by putting the time in, to put focus on their talent.
  • I have a BFA in fine arts from the prestigious Sage College of Albany. My focus is on printing, under the guidance of Harold Lohner.  Its well understood that my art, music, promoting career are all relative.
  1. What I am asking is for help to move my art, printing and music studio from Albany, New York to Chicago, Illinois. At this juncture in my life, there are more opportunities in Chicago, that will help me in establishing myself as the artist that I am and trying to achieve. Giving me the needs to set up a proper printing environment to execute design and product for artists who support artists. 
  2. Most important, is that I raise enough money to finish re issuing the out of print Clay People back catalogue . We (the ClayPeople) had almost finished one very important reissue, that we ran out of money on.  I will take that responsibility of re issuing the Clay People back catalogue myself. Independently and affordable!
  3. I need your help! I have put together several perks showcasing my best talents to raise enough money to take on this life change. The funding will go towards the move itself and making sure I have all the right tools to make this artists for artists studio available and inexpensive. From a proper press, to lighting, proper apps to render great digital product, proper working space, and materials available, so artists and musicians can be provided and afford the products they need for their projects. I will able me, to add to, the already great working environment, that is the greater art and music scene of Chicago! Help me achieve my goal of bringing my experience and talents to the up and coming artists and musicians of Chicago!

story:
Postcards and Letters from Santa!

It's really nice to find surprises, and no one is better at surprises than Santa!  Which might be because he's got so many helpers everywhere.  Either way, he's been geniusing Christmas for like, 2013 years.  Or 1700?

Sometimes in your life, you get a special calling.  Sometimes you need to move to Alaska, eat a lot of cookies, grow a beard that you may or may not have started in No-Shave November, don some gay apparel, and give people happiness, cheer, love, and mail!!!  Sometimes you get called to be Santa's helper.

Well I hope you're sitting down, because I've already moved to Alaska, eaten a decidedly unhealthy amount of cookies, grown a sharp and uneven creeper beard for a minute and then shaved and just charitably gave the money that the month of November required to avoid the termination of my job, donned the absolute gayest of apparel, and have been beaming happiness, cheer, and love like a carebear to everyone within 3 feet of me.  The last piece of the puzzle to me achieving my dream of Santaing the jingle bells out of this December is mail!!!

This is where you come in.

You see, when I relocated to Alaska in April to sprinkle a little adventure into my life, I was exploring the Fairbanks area, and happened across the town of North Pole.  I was delighted at their commitment to their theme, with candy cane street lamps and street names like Santa Claus Lane.  It was then that Santa possessed my spirit and entered my heart and called on me to be his helper.

I can't wait to send you stuff from the North Pole (Alaska)!

So what the money is for is the cost of creating the art, materials, a couple of tanks of expensive Alaskan gas because it's about a 5-7 hour drive depending on weather from Anchorage, a night at the Hotel North Pole so I wont have to do 10-14 hours of driving in one day, and maybe a box of cookies to munch along the way.  

For that, you get your choice of awesome fun things that will be sent by mail with an official postmark from North Pole, Alaska!

If for any reason your love of Christmas postcards and Santa mail exceeds my goal, you will be contributing toward my holiday return to New Jersey to see my family on Christmas.  Please, take a moment and get out your tiniest, saddest, instrument.  Violins preferred.  Or maybe that sad Charlie Brown Christmas music.  I'm typing this with my head down.

You see, as I have recently learned, flights get exhorbitantly expensive in Alaska at Christmas.  Around triple what they were in the summer.  Since I don't get paid time off at my new job, I would have to fly very specific days.  And since my girlfriend had more flexibility, she was able to get a reasonable flight and is already in NJ working from there. Because it's so unrealistic, I pretty much wrote off going back "home" for Christmas. But don't feel bad, Skype makes it just like being there.  That's what any extra will be put toward.  Sort of like you would be mailing me from the North Pole to my loved ones.  Meta.

This isn't a sad story, let's get back to the cheer!

The point of this is that I'm excited to take this trip and send these very adorable things!  I love Alaska and can't wait to send you something from this magical place!

We designed a postcard for this specific project, which we won't show you so you can be surprised too! (Nothing naughty!)

And letters from Santa on Santa letterhead!?!?!?  Santastic!

I'll be mailing everything on Saturday, December 14th.  This should give plenty of time for everything to get everywhere it needs to be by Christmas.

If you have a little one, or a big one, or any kind of loved one, if nothing else, I hope it makes them excited about the little, magical things in the world, and I'm extremely happy to be a vessel for that.

*Please note, we will email you for the specific sender information for each perk, as there isn't a customization option when purchasing.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may have all the items from the North Pole you can handle, but maybe you know someone who would LOVE something Christmasy from the Arctic realm.  TELL THEM!!!  Tell the world!!!  Make a Christmas miracle happen!
story_txt: Postcards and Letters from Santa!It's really nice to find surprises, and no one is better at surprises than Santa!  Which might be because he's got so many helpers everywhere.  Either way, he's been geniusing Christmas for like, 2013 years.  Or 1700?Sometimes in your life, you get a special calling.  Sometimes you need to move to Alaska, eat a lot of cookies, grow a beard that you may or may not have started in No-Shave November, don some gay apparel, and give people happiness, cheer, love, and mail!!!  Sometimes you get called to be Santa's helper.Well I hope you're sitting down, because I've already moved to Alaska, eaten a decidedly unhealthy amount of cookies, grown a sharp and uneven creeper beard for a minute and then shaved and just charitably gave the money that the month of November required to avoid the termination of my job, donned the absolute gayest of apparel, and have been beaming happiness, cheer, and love like a carebear to everyone within 3 feet of me.  The last piece of the puzzle to me achieving my dream of Santaing the jingle bells out of this December is mail!!!This is where you come in.You see, when I relocated to Alaska in April to sprinkle a little adventure into my life, I was exploring the Fairbanks area, and happened across the town of North Pole.  I was delighted at their commitment to their theme, with candy cane street lamps and street names like Santa Claus Lane.  It was then that Santa possessed my spirit and entered my heart and called on me to be his helper.I can't wait to send you stuff from the North Pole (Alaska)!So what the money is for is the cost of creating the art, materials, a couple of tanks of expensive Alaskan gas because it's about a 5-7 hour drive depending on weather from Anchorage, a night at the Hotel North Pole so I wont have to do 10-14 hours of driving in one day, and maybe a box of cookies to munch along the way.  For that, you get your choice of awesome fun things that will be sent by mail with an official postmark from North Pole, Alaska!If for any reason your love of Christmas postcards and Santa mail exceeds my goal, you will be contributing toward my holiday return to New Jersey to see my family on Christmas.  Please, take a moment and get out your tiniest, saddest, instrument.  Violins preferred.  Or maybe that sad Charlie Brown Christmas music.  I'm typing this with my head down.You see, as I have recently learned, flights get exhorbitantly expensive in Alaska at Christmas.  Around triple what they were in the summer.  Since I don't get paid time off at my new job, I would have to fly very specific days.  And since my girlfriend had more flexibility, she was able to get a reasonable flight and is already in NJ working from there. Because it's so unrealistic, I pretty much wrote off going back "home" for Christmas. But don't feel bad, Skype makes it just like being there.  That's what any extra will be put toward.  Sort of like you would be mailing me from the North Pole to my loved ones.  Meta.This isn't a sad story, let's get back to the cheer!The point of this is that I'm excited to take this trip and send these very adorable things!  I love Alaska and can't wait to send you something from this magical place!We designed a postcard for this specific project, which we won't show you so you can be surprised too! (Nothing naughty!)And letters from Santa on Santa letterhead!?!?!?  Santastic!I'll be mailing everything on Saturday, December 14th.  This should give plenty of time for everything to get everywhere it needs to be by Christmas.If you have a little one, or a big one, or any kind of loved one, if nothing else, I hope it makes them excited about the little, magical things in the world, and I'm extremely happy to be a vessel for that.*Please note, we will email you for the specific sender information for each perk, as there isn't a customization option when purchasing.Other Ways You Can HelpYou may have all the items from the North Pole you can handle, but maybe you know someone who would LOVE something Christmasy from the Arctic realm.  TELL THEM!!!  Tell the world!!!  Make a Christmas miracle happen!

story:
The Lumiphonic Creature Choir is a giant 12 headed creature that people can interact and play with. 

We need your support to make the Creatures stronger to survive and experience the great outdoors!! Help us bring the Lumiphonic Creature Choir to life for Burning Man 2015!  

Who are the Creatures? 

The Lumiphonic Creature Choir is a giant 12 headed creature that people can directly interact and play with. A cutting edge installation and live audio-visual performance, it explores new forms of interactive music, sculpture and film, and seeks to capture the atmosphere of magical wonder and innovative technology found in the late 19th Century parlours of science, magic and invention.

The Creatures combine a multitude of perspectives, offering tremendous opportunities for makers and artists from across many disciplines to collaborate.  The Creatues have worked with multimedia artists, projection mappers, electronic musicians, beat-boxers, gospel singers, classical vocalists, programmers, interface designers, engineers, fabricators, generative sound artists, sculptors, and evolutionary coders, among others, in finding compelling new ways to tell meaningful human stories. 

Give the Creatures New Life

For Burning Man, we must rebuild the Creature Choir to withstand the extreme conditions of the Nevada Desert - 110mph winds, scorching heat in the day, freezing conditions at night, alkaline sand that bites into  everything from skin to metal. The Creatures are delicate and fragile at the moment, and we want to strengthen their bodies!  

After Burning Man, we intend to take them around the world... to all sorts of outdoor festivals and unusual venues.  So our investment in a stronger body will pay off in more opportunities for our beloved Creatures to see the world. We will be converting their PVC skeleton into powerfully strong yet organically curved metal, and reshaping their faces from delicate paper mache to durable fiberglass.

Though primarily nocturnal, the Creatures will also now come alive during the  day. The Creatures' heads will be mounted on motors, which allow the heads to gently sway about during the day.  At night, the Creatures will fully awaken to sing, speak, and interact with participants. 

Become Part of the Creature Family

The Creatures are modest, but they are eager to bring their unique talents to the 70,000 participants at the 2015 Burning Man festival.  Burning Man has generously crafted a comfortable, centally located lair (at the Man Base!) for the Creature to reside in during their stay at the festival.  

The Creatures are delighted and deeply honored to be selected as an Honorarium project this year.  Burning Man has provided partial funding, but the Creatures need YOU to help get them the rest of the way there! 

The Honorarium grant will only cover most their body modifications.  We need to raise the funds that will cover the rest of the modifications, the transportation, and the crew who will take care of the Creatures during the event. 

Every donation, no matter the amount, is deeply appreciated by the entire Creature family.

Our $17,000 total budget includes: 

  • Fabricating new necks from metal ($6,000)

  • Re-making the heads out of durable, weather-resistant fiberglass ($3,000)

  • Interactive components such as stomp pads, sensors, arduinos, and electronics ($2,000)

  • Shipping and transportation for The Creatures and building crew from New York City to Black Rock City and back ($6,000)

Our team of dedicated and enthusiastic volunteers are deeply grateful for any level of financial support, and we are proud to have your encouragement.

We will be posting updates throughout the summer  as the Creatures take living form in New York City. Please support us today, and follow the Creature's progress our Facebook page, Instagram, and our website.

About the Team

The Creature Family is newly forming, and growing.  Our team members hail from a variety of backgrounds and have come together from the four corners for the first time to help the Creature realize its dream of getting to Burning Man. 

Mark Bolotin - Lead Artist, Virgin Burner from the Land of Oz
Becky Neil - Project Lead, 9th Year Burner, 6th Playa Art Project, San Francisco
Xi Liu - Fundraising and Crew Care, Virgin Burner from the Land of Oz
Nicola Bailey - Fundraising Co-Lead, Virgin Burner from the Land of Oz
Alana Aviel - Fabrication Lead and Metal Artist, Virgin Burner from Hawai'i 
Alberto Quintero - Crew, Virgin Burner from Mexico
Alex Petrowsky - Sculptor, 7-year veteran burner hailing from Austria
Alex Post & Sophia Hanover - Graphics
Ali Lahijanian - structural engineer, experinced West Coast burner
Chris Anderson - Creature Motion and Interaction, Veteran Burner from San Francisco
Diana Castro - Interactive Magic and Interface Designer, Virgin Burner from Mexico City
Joris Luijke - Technology Wizard, Strike Lead, Virgin Burner & 
Kate McGahee - Crew

Robin Wachsberger - Party Planner and Playa Sherpa...or Cylon! 5 year veteran burner from Brooklyn by way of Philly
Trevor Turnell - Creature Head Doctor, Virgin Burner from Upstate NY

A huge thanks to Asher Remy-Toledo and Hyphen Hub for the ongoing support.

story:
The NYC FIGMENT Sculpture Garden on Governors Island is a non-profit interactive art project that over the past 2 years has enabled artists to share their works with the public on NYC’s historic Governors Island.  Through public and private donation the Sculpture Garden has been a great success receiving over 200,000 visitors in 2010.  The Sculpture Garden is free and open to the public Friday, Saturday and Sunday on Governors Island from June 4 to October 9, 2011.  

 

  The sculpture Becky’s Dream Catcher, an 18’ in diameter geodesic sphere made of oak struts and aluminum hubs, will have a 12’ X 24’ oversized hammock suspended in the center where visitors to the island can go to relax and pass the time.  The sculpture will mainly be constructed using recycled materials.  Becky’s Dream Catcher has been accepted as a finalist in the selection process to be part of this year’s NYC FIGMENT Sculpture Garden.  Final selections will be made in April, pending funding. 

 

  As a non-profit organization FIGMENT relies on donations to make the public interactive Sculpture Garden possible.  By using donations, FIGMENT helps artists realize their visions.  Donations to the Becky’s Dream Catcher project will help make this year’s Sculpture Garden a great success.  Donations will be diverted to the FIGMENT Sculpture Garden in the event Becky’s Dream Catcher project is not included in this year’s Sculpture Garden Project for any reason.  However all contributors to the Becky’s Dream Catcher project will still receive an 8-1/2” X 11” print of one of the artist’s previous sculptures suitable for framing.  If the goal is met please keep donating as the total cost for the Becky’s Dream Catcher project is over $2,500.  Any funds collected over the goal will help relieve the financial burden FIGMENT takes on putting the NYC Sculpture Garden together and will help allow more artist’s sculptures to be included in this year’s Sculpture Garden project.

 

  Tax deductible donations can also be made by going directly to the NYC FIGMENT site at http://www.figmentproject.org/donate and specify that the contribution is for Becky’s Dream Catcher project.  Thank you for your interest and participation in making this year’s event possible.

story:
Nima: a sprawling, red-dirt neighborhood in the heart of Accra. Rich with culture, community, and history, but long considered a slum, avoided by tourists and Accra residents alike. Within the neighborhood itself, the arts are generally disregarded, often disrespected.

A group of artists born-and-bred in Nima want to change that perception.


Will you help us?


NIMA: MUHINMANCHI ART is conceived to establish Nima as a place for the arts, to bring art to the community, and to empower local JHS students. 

The festive opening night, with art, music and food, will draw in both the local neighborhood and greater Accra’s art and intellectual crowd. We will hold an exhibition and sale of students’ and artists’ individual work, to benefit the students and the Junior Art Club, an Accra-based, Nima-founded organization. A mural designed and painted by the students and artists will act as the centerpiece of the opening and serve as a lasting art installation in the neighborhood.

 

Who?

 

JHS students, emerging and established artists, residents of Nima, and attendees from greater Accra

 

Why?

 

We seek to foster a positive perception of art and give the students a chance to explore their creativity. The work brings art beyond gallery and museum walls, into the every day of one of Accra’s poorest neighborhoods. Individual works will go home with people from all over Accra (maybe one will go to you). The mural will stay in Nima. Such a project, never before seen in Nima, is a unique opportunity for people from the neighborhood to create and appreciate an installation; and for people from all over Accra to participate with art in a space they might not usually encounter.

What We Need

Art Supplies: $200 (paints, brushes, glue, scissors, canvas)

Food: $200 (rice, chicken, nibbles, refreshments, cutlery)

Promotional Materials: $40 (flyers, cards, invitations)

*June 7 update* turns out we need $120 for promotional materials... Poster printing costs aren't so affordable when you don't have the Haverford printing center. So more support would be, ahem, great.

Miscellaneous costs: $60 (board from the market, rope and settings for display, stamps for invitations)

To explain: we’re seeking local sponsors to contribute supplies, ergo amounts listed are lower than actual costs…but our demands are pretty high, and we need some partial contributions.

If we raise extra money (!), we’ll use the funds to make the event bigger and better, whether this means more art, food, music, etc.

story:
“It is in Apple’s DNA that technology alone is not enough—it’s technology married with arts, married with the humanities, that yields us the results that make our heart sing.”
–Steve Jobs

"If we don’t have art in our lives we can never really be healthy people. If we don’t participate in creative endeavors, we can never really be whole and well adjusted. And when you find those kids who are generally happy about what they do, about who they are, you can bet that somewhere in their lives, art has made a connection."

- Frank Walker
Kentucky Governor’s School for the Arts

The Mission 

Art Education funds in our schools are being cut or eliminated entirely. The Gallery Project is ART, COMMUNITY, CONNECTION. We are a non-profit incubator where today's youth learn about art, community, identity and commerce.  A unique environment where dialogue is created using traditional art forms and exploring new boundaries to form a conversation for experimental projects.  This platform serves as a catalyst to use art to create both community and social change.

A place that embraces cultural diversity and brings communities together through projects that foster and ignite the creative spirit. The Gallery Project will offer programming that will build up the individual, make them feel part of something and boost confidence. Programming will be centered around team building art projects that help communities break down barriers, work together and be a part of something that has a positive impact on society. Throughout the creative process, young people can celebrate diversity and their individual response to the world around them. These programs can also play a special role in reducing racial and income achievement gaps by providing access to enrichment activities more readily available to higher income students. All donations are tax-deductible.  

Founder and Director, Annie Bolling has more than 15 years of experience working in a variety of gallery environments. After obtaining her B.F.A. from the University of Cincinnati's School of Design, Architecture, Art and Planning, Annie began her        professional career at Closson's. There she worked closely with Phyllis Weston, a long-time champion of the arts in Cincinnati. Annie's energy, attitude and zeal have solidified her place in the gallery scene and with Weston, she partnered to create the Phyllis Weston-Annie Bolling Gallery. Annie later opened her own gallery spaces, including the Annie Bolling Gallery in Oakley and PAC Gallery in East Walnut Hills.

It's from her work with young artists that Annie is reminded of how important art is to, not only a community, but to society as a whole. And, while she has an affinity for contemporary art, Annie equally values making art more accessible through a variety of methods, styles and mediums.

story:
Music, media and the arts overall are a global language. The youth respond to these arts and they are listening to the artists....so lets give something to both-the artists to create art relevant to what's happening to the youth and give the youth a way to express what's happening to them peacefully. 


Who Are We?

Existence is Resistance Our Mission Statement

Existence is Resistance (EIR) was founded in 2009 following the grotesque offensive bombing attacks on Gaza. While the bombing was still going on, we quickly organized a relief concert in New York City raising a few thousand dollars for the victims in just two hours. After seeing the diverse crowd and unity of the attendees and all that were willing to help, we quickly realized the power of music and artistic expression in the context of oppression. EIR promotes and implements this theory in all past and future projects. EIR strives to unite marginalized youth globally with outlets in the arts to express, process and improve their situations. Our organization is here to work in the communities of those under going oppression while recognizing the empowering artistic talents of the people, we feel that one must acknowledge that inspiration is the key to expressing these talents, and the proper tools to find ones ability is the catalyst for great change. An empowered society is a powerful society.

 

What Do We Want To Do?

2012 Project 

Living under occupation, creative expression is often stifled. Lack of funds,
violence and other obstacles regularly prevent school-aged youth from expressive, artistic activities that belong to a healthy childhood. We believe through culture, arts and shown solidarity, these children facing adversity will become inspired to create the society in which they deserve to exist. Existence is Resistance is hoping to conduct its 2012 Tour  for ten days expanding the cities visited in previous years, increasing the variety of workshops to include filming, editing, web-designing and ensuring that there will be at least one instructor in each youth center EIR works with to continue the programs. EIR hopes to again donate laptops and cameras (specifically flipcams) to each youth center. Tours of each city will be conducted earlier in the day with a local to explain each cities history and current situations, workshops will commence for 5 hours a day ending with a show every other evening in which the children who participated in the workshops also perform with the artists to show what they learnt. The children’s footage filmed during the entire tour will be used in our next documentary.

We have some amazing artists interested in going this year, all of which are donating their time and efforts. Funding is strictly for the transportation, hiring of the buses in the West Bank, food and accomodation which we purchase 100% from the refugee camps. Most money goes on the purchase of laptops and cameras in the West Bank at a Palestinian-owned business. Bearing in mind it is a little more expensive there but we do want to keep all monies there if possible. 

Financial reports are available each year upon request for all non-profit and foundation grants within a few weeks of returning from the tour. Individual donors are also eligible to view our extremely transparent reports.

 

How Can We Get There?

6 Ways To See Our Project Through

1. Donate, anything you can, even just $5

2. Donate Airmiles!! Please if you have them to spare, donate airmiles to sponsor youth or an artist to come on this life changing experience. 

3. Buy a t-shirt. We silk screen our t-shirts by hand in Brooklyn, NY. http://www.existenceisresistance.bigcartel.com/ 

4. Screen our film at your University or College. Many of you have funds to screen independent documentaries with educational value. Host one!

5. Screen our film in your home with a crowd of 10 or more! This is hosting a really intimate showing of Hip Hop Is Bigger Than the Occupation and pooling some donations together. All hosts get a fre EIR t-shirt!

6. Share! Share! Share! Sometimes we cannot donate, BUT we can be in solidarity!

 

The Impact

The artists we have taken in the past have continued their work participating in full tours around the US including panels which they talk on their trip to the West Bank, what they saw and how it changed their life. They also keep in touch with the youth in Palestine which keeps both parties motivated and empowered.

The artists blog from the trip also back home....here are a couple of powerful entries:

 http://www.existenceisresistance.org/archives/997

http://www.existenceisresistance.org/archives/1005



Past Tours

“24 hrs” Gaza Strip July 2009
In July 2009, Existence is Resistance took a small delegation of Hip Hop artists with a humanitarian convoy to the Gaza strip. Dealing with stressful situations whilst being stuck in Egypt for 8 days, after days of negotiations, the convoy was eventually permitted to enter Gaza for only 24 hours. During those 24 hours EIR took the artists to the home of a Palestinian artist which had been bombed and resulted in his fathers death. EIR also took them on a complete tour of the destruction and beauty of Gaza and its people. The artists talked to Gazans at a prisoner center where mothers, children and others who have lost loved ones and performed before leaving at a Gaza Hotel.

“Bus Stop Hip Hop Tour” West Bank 2010
Existence is Resistance, The South West Youth Collaborative and The University of Hip Hop Chicago, came together last year and organized a ten day musical/artistic workshop and performance tour in the West Bank. The Seven artists from the United States/United Kingdom and the two youth performers from SWYC/UHHC conducted daily workshops with the children
in the refugee camps and occupied West Bank. The tour reached 6 cities, the performers of diverse ethnic and racial backgrounds and of different faiths. The tour was documented and will be released on DVD May 2011 titled “Hip Hop is Bigger than the Occupation”. Donations from Caipirinha Foundation made it possible for EIR to purchase and donate musical instruments for the youth centers within the refugee camps.

“Freedom Tour” West Bank 2011
Existence is Resistance again raised funds to conduct a ten day tour throughout the West Bank with artists from the US and the UK. During the time there the tour visited "Nabi Saleh" and could not conduct the workshops, nor tour since the Israeli army came in and started firing all over. The tour was sitting in one house which was also gassed during this time. The tour was named the Freedom Tour in dedication to Juliano Mer-Khamis, Founder of the Freedom theater in Jenin who was murdered earlier that year.  This year we donated laptops and flipcams to the centers we worked with teaching the youth how to film, edit and upload.
story_txt:
Music, media and the arts overall are a global language. The youth respond to these arts and they are listening to the artists....so lets give something to both-the artists to create art relevant to what's happening to the youth and give the youth a way to express what's happening to them peacefully. 

Who Are We?
Existence is Resistance Our Mission Statement
Existence is Resistance (EIR) was founded in 2009 following the grotesque offensive bombing attacks on Gaza. While the bombing was still going on, we quickly organized a relief concert in New York City raising a few thousand dollars for the victims in just two hours. After seeing the diverse crowd and unity of the attendees and all that were willing to help, we quickly realized the power of music and artistic expression in the context of oppression. EIR promotes and implements this theory in all past and future projects. EIR strives to unite marginalized youth globally with outlets in the arts to express, process and improve their situations. Our organization is here to work in the communities of those under going oppression while recognizing the empowering artistic talents of the people, we feel that one must acknowledge that inspiration is the key to expressing these talents, and the proper tools to find ones ability is the catalyst for great change. An empowered society is a powerful society.
 
What Do We Want To Do?
2012 Project 
Living under occupation, creative expression is often stifled. Lack of funds,violence and other obstacles regularly prevent school-aged youth from expressive, artistic activities that belong to a healthy childhood. We believe through culture, arts and shown solidarity, these children facing adversity will become inspired to create the society in which they deserve to exist. Existence is Resistance is hoping to conduct its 2012 Tour  for ten days expanding the cities visited in previous years, increasing the variety of workshops to include filming, editing, web-designing and ensuring that there will be at least one instructor in each youth center EIR works with to continue the programs. EIR hopes to again donate laptops and cameras (specifically flipcams) to each youth center. Tours of each city will be conducted earlier in the day with a local to explain each cities history and current situations, workshops will commence for 5 hours a day ending with a show every other evening in which the children who participated in the workshops also perform with the artists to show what they learnt. The children’s footage filmed during the entire tour will be used in our next documentary.
We have some amazing artists interested in going this year, all of which are donating their time and efforts. Funding is strictly for the transportation, hiring of the buses in the West Bank, food and accomodation which we purchase 100% from the refugee camps. Most money goes on the purchase of laptops and cameras in the West Bank at a Palestinian-owned business. Bearing in mind it is a little more expensive there but we do want to keep all monies there if possible. 
Financial reports are available each year upon request for all non-profit and foundation grants within a few weeks of returning from the tour. Individual donors are also eligible to view our extremely transparent reports.


 
How Can We Get There?
6 Ways To See Our Project Through
1. Donate, anything you can, even just $5
2. Donate Airmiles!! Please if you have them to spare, donate airmiles to sponsor youth or an artist to come on this life changing experience. 
3. Buy a t-shirt. We silk screen our t-shirts by hand in Brooklyn, NY. http://www.existenceisresistance.bigcartel.com/ 
4. Screen our film at your University or College. Many of you have funds to screen independent documentaries with educational value. Host one!
5. Screen our film in your home with a crowd of 10 or more! This is hosting a really intimate showing of Hip Hop Is Bigger Than the Occupation and pooling some donations together. All hosts get a fre EIR t-shirt!
6. Share! Share! Share! Sometimes we cannot donate, BUT we can be in solidarity!
 


The Impact
The artists we have taken in the past have continued their work participating in full tours around the US including panels which they talk on their trip to the West Bank, what they saw and how it changed their life. They also keep in touch with the youth in Palestine which keeps both parties motivated and empowered.
The artists blog from the trip also back home....here are a couple of powerful entries:
 http://www.existenceisresistance.org/archives/997
http://www.existenceisresistance.org/archives/1005




Past Tours

Dealing with stressful situations whilst being stuck in Egypt for 8 days, after days of negotiations, the convoy was eventually permitted to enter Gaza for only 24 hours. During those 24 hours EIR took the artists to the home of a Palestinian artist which had been bombed and resulted in his fathers death. EIR also took them on a complete tour of the destruction and beauty of Gaza and its people. The artists talked to Gazans at a prisoner center where mothers, children and others who have lost loved ones and performed before leaving at a Gaza Hotel.
“Bus Stop Hip Hop Tour” West Bank 2010Existence is Resistance, The South West Youth Collaborative and The University of Hip Hop Chicago, came together last year and organized a ten day musical/artistic workshop and performance tour in the West Bank. The Seven artists from the United States/United Kingdom and the two youth performers from SWYC/UHHC conducted daily workshops with the childrenin the refugee camps and occupied West Bank. The tour reached 6 cities, the performers of diverse ethnic and racial backgrounds and of different faiths. The tour was documented and will be released on DVD May 2011 titled “Hip Hop is Bigger than the Occupation”. Donations from Caipirinha Foundation made it possible for EIR to purchase and donate musical instruments for the youth centers within the refugee camps.
“Freedom Tour” West Bank 2011Existence is Resistance again raised funds to conduct a ten day tour throughout the West Bank with artists from the US and the UK. During the time there the tour visited "Nabi Saleh" and could not conduct the workshops, nor tour since the Israeli army came in and started firing all over. The tour was named the Freedom Tour in dedication to Juliano Mer-Khamis, Founder of the Freedom theater in Jenin who was murdered earlier that year.  This year we donated laptops and flipcams to the centers we worked with teaching the youth how to film, edit and upload.

X THIEF X CONVICT

I was born and brought up in the ghetto all my youth life i was a thief stealing  life mugging was what i new in my life i was convicted in children's juvenile prison were i learned a lesson ,The arts and craft practically .i was released from juvenile prisons in 1993 i service with art ,wall branding ,and manual rubber stamps making with razor blade , that the way i survive in this jungle .

ART PROMOTION IN PRISONS

As the fonder to be i am committed to combating ART TALENT CONVICTS to the art platforms of creativity , design and to raise lost art glory from the grave to reality and perfection of lost culture due to techno systems which created jobless corner , my project only needs 120,000$ for space for gallery to exhibition there works of paint and materials for more supply in EAST AFRICA PRISONS CORRECTIONS FACILITIES to promote arts and craft modelling, To hire art more artist teachers to teach them art in the prisons by session .

to promote Music

-This project will help to cut crime rate a little in the society of mob justice.


-Art and craft

paintings,Obstructs,casting,models 3d,4d,5d,gypsum art will help to feed their families.


-Education their-

 strictly practical no theory.


I NEED YOUR SUPPORT


There are many Art talented convicts needs some more knowledge and gears and space to produce more fantastic s arts and crafts and models . my only challenging is space for this handsome pretty campaign.

I know is hard to earn a dollar so i appreciate any penny you donate for this drive destination to the lost world the lost society of Law Breakers,and the innocent ones who needs to prosper a talent back in the society of Art platform with art lovers.  HELP ME AM NOT A SUCKER.

story:
Sandy Colman, Designer/CEO of Don Colman Clothing launched a campaign to support local youth involved with Pretty Smart Girls, a foundation dedicated to empowering and equipping girls to become successful, well-rounded, diligent women. The 50 day campaign will allow the girls involved with the foundation to participate in monthly cultural, social and academic activities, while also promoting community advancement and involvement. The campaign will also benefit the Don Colman brand by providing resources to expand its merchandise and begin manufacturing on a larger scale. With a projected goal of $20,000, Sandy hopes to unite women locally, nationally and internationally, while also promoting the importance of investing in our youth. “I really want to inspire the Pretty Smart Girls to dream, reach and see beyond their present, and ignite the vision for their future”, Colman emphatically expressed. Colman will also donate a portion of all online sales to creating a scholarship fund for Pretty Smart Girls; the Angel Scholarship will be rewarded annually, and all active members of Pretty Smart Girls will have the opportunity to apply.

Mioshi Johnson and Dionne Anglin, the co-founders of Pretty Smart Girls, started the organization with their own daughters and family members, and it has now grown to include girls from all over the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex. “We really had a vision for our daughters, and it grew from there. These girls inspire me, and I am grateful for the opportunity to nurture their growth”, Jackson stated.

The campaign will culminate with a fashion show that highlights the members of Pretty Smart Girls, and serves as a recruiting event for all interested in joining the foundation. Active members of Pretty Smart Girls will have the opportunity to model in the "Pretty Smart Girls Fashion Show", and the Angel Scholarship will be awarded. The fashion show will be a private event, and will celebrate the success of the campaign.


Proceeds from this campaign will support—

-Cultural, social and academic activities and outings for active members of the Pretty Smart Girls Foundation

-The Angel Scholarship, awarded annually to an active member of the Pretty Smart Girls Foundation

-Stage One of manufacturing for Don Colman Clothing

-Female entrepreneurship and empowerment in the Dallas metroplex and beyond!


Thank you for your financial support—the incentives that we have listed don’t even compare to the joy, hope and inspiration that you are providing to the girls of Pretty Smart Girls Foundation, so please know that you are appreciated! I really wanted to bring a vision to life, not only for Don Colman Clothing, but for women everywhere, especially by supporting female entrepreneurship and inspiring our young people to dream, hope and live according to their purpose. Your support is more than money—you are creating life and turning dreams into reality. Thank you!

story:
Okay, here we go!

For the last two years I have tried to start my own company named pinkwhY. I was fixed by the idea of being a founder which seems to be something “en vogue” in these days.

Currently I am in deep trouble as it seems to be tough to attract German business angels and investors for funding. See more below at the headline: Trouble ahead: Jail is calling


About my business idea:

I thought (and still do) that my idea is good. Of course. The roughest description is “online art trading platform”. But the idea is more than only trading original artworks as almost every online plat form does. I have studied and experienced the art market for a long time now. Out there are many platforms who offer artworks. From my perspective an online concept should consider more than simply putting an analog product into a web shop. Exactly that's what all online art traders are doing so far. Hence we are – we means the future company – going to make advantage of this by using technical achievements to make art reproducible and as well digital. The digital product will be a novelty in the art industry and will give users the chance even to utilize art on screens and way more interesting in the digital sphere.

A comparison of the music and book industry examines, that this is possible. In those industries reproduction is established for centuries. And both have realized that customer needs have changed and that the business future lies in the digital sphere. Thus they adjust their business models – successful as the music industries proofs with own downloads offers – since they painfully suffered from illegal downloads. This indicates a high potential for the art industry.

Here are the unique selling points of my concept:

1.  Digitalization & Reproduction: This allows to establish new revenue streams for artists. Or to turn the question around. You never purchase the master tape or the original manuscript. Or do you have the master tape of Rolling Stones “Satisfaction”? Would it be that worth and well known when there were no records of it sold? Why then do so many people try to explain that art should be different? Of course the Rolling Stones are live the best. But do you really care when your number one hit streams through your headphones? Digitalization & Reproduction allows to establish a kind of art billboard charts. As the price development in the art industry is opaque we are going to deliver transparency. From now on not gallerists are saying what is hot or not and what the prices will be. But the customer. It also allows to focus a mass market who hasn’t been touched so far. The success of Banksy highlighted this as he received the fame from thousands of art lovers but not from the Gallery scene in his early days.

The digitalization will not be a problem for the art industry in case you learn from other creative industries. Or as Kevin Spacey puts it for the film industry: “We have learned the lesson that the music industry didn't learn. Give people what they want, when they want it, in the form they want it in, at a reasonable price – and they'll more likely pay for it rather than steal it.“

2.  Focus on talented and upcoming artists of all genres: The majority of art lovers only focus on big artist. As an art lover you want to be the first one who discovers a new upcoming artist. Hence it is important to get new artists on the radar as there are so many fantastic ones are out there waiting to get a chance. Though we focus the pre-gallery-market to bring structure in it. Like my space does.

3.  Focus on affordable Artworks (average artwork below 3.000 Euro): To be honest - all the Richters, Koons and Hirsts have started as no names. That was the time when their original artworks were affordable to an even way much bigger market. The more successful they are the more their value increases. Hence it is interesting to be one of the first owners for the originals. Also if you are not a rich customer.

Okay, many people will now argue that is better to focus on the expensive products. Well let’s have a look on the automobile industry. You never buy the prototype. And not every customer can purchase for example a Lamborghini. Instead the majority of customers can only achieve e.g. a good Volkswagen. That’s what we focus on. And guess what. Lamborghini is part of the Volkswagen Group.

4.  Participation on value increase: That’s another important side effect from the Digitalization & Reproduction element. Especially for the artist who participates the most on a value increase. In case you sell reproductions and the original artwork is still on stock – the sold reproductions are an indicator that there is or will be a demand for the original artwork. Maybe not at the moment. But the more reproductions are sold the more the price for the original artwork can increase. That’s the moment when the Volkswagen becomes a Lamborghini.

When I look on the USP´s we are a combination of e-commerce and digital media with influences of a good gallery, Lumas and Jamba/Jamster. Thus I don’t fear other internet art startups such as Artsy or Amazon´s efforts to become a relevant art trader. What I am concerned of is the bad experience of other founders with copycats who are copying good concepts and sometimes are more successful than the original idea. Hence it is my intent not to face the same experience, and to collect enough money to be prepared for that challenge. To give a clear idea of what I am talking about I refer to the invasion of the Normandy. In order to achieve the overall goal to defeat the Third Reich it was relevant not only to have enough resources to win a single battle. It was relevant to make sure to have enough resources in order to win the entire war!

So far so good. With focus on collecting money my problems started. I never was able to raise enough money neither to cover my personal monthly costs nor to shift the focus on customer acquisition. There were so many people who showed interest to invest in my idea but who withdraw their interest when it came down to sign the contract. Though I had to struggle every month to survive and was able to push the idea only in little steps. Yes, my intend was and is not to start small like starting as a small gallery. So many galleries face a hard life nowadays. I want to make advantage out of it by combining it with the internet and the digital. Nevertheless we have achieved several relevant elements to get start the company right in the moment we find an investor. The business plan is written and the concept was reviewed and certified of plausibility by the Chamber of Commerce Halle-Dessau. We also received a certification for “innovative concept” from the Academic Founders Network Saxony-Anhalt. An expert jury (lawyer, tax account, bank, and entrepreneur) from the Junior International Club Dessau gave a general recommendation to investment in the idea. There are also investors like private family offices and venture capital who would like to invest in a real Series A round. And we have customers from both; B2B and B2C who are waiting for our official start.

I, two other founders, a small team, and two board members are ready to implement the concept and to demonstrate the proof of concept. Therefore 4 Million Euro are necessary within the next three years to set up the company and to get the pace which is relevant to win the battles in the art market. No worries we don’t need the entire amount at once. I simply want to make sure that we don’t lack on financial support when we have started. Hence we are currently looking for 50.000 Euro up to 250.000 Euro.


Trouble ahead: Jail is calling

Nevertheless, putting all energy and focus on collecting money I lost the most important aspect. To make people and artists happy. Many investors say they want to see a founder’s passion and power of endurance. This is my proof. I was also able to collect money from family, friends and “fools” to get to this point. As mentioned it was never enough to cover my monthly costs. The current situation is as follows: I have the last 200 Euro in my hands and on next Monday I am going to lose my apartment and my office if I am not able to collect some money. Therefore at least 5.000 Euro are necessary to avoid it. Otherwise I am going to be homeless and furthermore to get into jail. This would break my neck.

But this is not going to happen as I am willing to get to the next point while collecting the necessary amount to start the company. Because for several weeks now I am struggling with the decision either to try to move on or to stop all my startup activities and to find a job. I applied for regular jobs but to be honest: I can’t get the business idea out of my mind. So I started to think about what kind of other option could be possible. While thinking through it and writing it down it seems to be an important and also extraordinary situation. And this requires extraordinary action. Doing another pitch or being another funding project on a platform? No! Hence it is my intention to turn this around. It’s important to get on the radar of the right people.

As so many investors stress the fact that they only invest in founders who put the interests of the company above their own I decided to give proof of exactly this. I will give proof again of my willingness. An essential quote is on my mind for almost a year now and which characterizes my personal attitude:

I will always place the mission first.

I will never accept defeat.

I will never quit.

This is what I was trained for: As a soldier and officer who completed deployments to the Kosovo and to Afghanistan. So please investors don’t tell me anymore something about commitment, responsibility, teamwork, management or even leadership!

My decision is still clear: I will move on. For now with a full strategy change as I wasted too much time to identify potential Business Angels and VC´s and to get access to them. At least to get a “no interest” or even no reply at all. Or even to get the runaround with a decision. I don’t care anymore if my idea is not in your investment focus; or the company generates no profit so far; or you don’t believe in a specific piece of the entire business plan; or you don’t know me; or we are just another startup amongst many (the same is vice versa); or you have a friend in the art sphere who does not believe in the entire business idea (of course not as we are going to change it); or you simply don’t have the nuts to take the risk. I don’t want to waste my time any longer. I want to meet the people whom I haven’t met so far and who want to provide financial support. Either with a small or a big amount. Every cent counts in large amounts.


My plan

And this is my plan: I will cycle as long as necessary to reach my funding goal. Parallel there will be a crowd-funding/crowd-investing round.

The cycle tour is a bit motivated by Forrest Gump´s long run but in this case with some clear purposes as they are:

1.  To represent what kind of stresses and strains entrepreneurs world-wide face every day,

2.  To raise awareness for founders with fantastic ideas out there,

3.  To calm down especially the German uber-Angst of early stage investments and to demonstrate that the German startup-scene should not be seen as pessimistic as this week’s article from the Wirtschaftswoche (#wiwo #startup) about the German startup-scene.

First of all I will get to my state capital Magdeburg to pee on the building which contains the governmental owned Investment Bank and the Business Angels club. Against your own mission you are not supportive for the local startup ecosystem. Stephan Groschupf as the CEO from Datameer.com stressed it on his speech on last year’s InvestForum in Halle. You guys have the exact attitude as outlined in the article of the WiWo. My next stops will be Berlin - the German paradise for founders - then Hamburg, Duesseldorf, Cologne, Frankfurt, Munich. Hopefully with the goal that I have collected enough money to return to Dessau to start the company.

To get me right: I am not running away from my responsibilities. I simply try to find another option between jail and committing suicide! Both are not really scaring me. And both are no proper solution. Because inside I am still highly motivated to get my idea become reality.


Your support:

Now is the moment where you come in and this is my deal offer: If this story is worth and you would like to support me, share the post and donate minimum five Euro. Take it as a lottery. In case the company will be founded you will get a share on my company according to the donated amount or on whatever you supported me during my journey (see the route below). I am also happy when you support me with a place to sleep, a shower or something to eat. A RedBull from time to time would be a highlight. (Hey RedBull, will you support me with some drinks? PS: Founders need more then pizza and coffee. They need energy!)

If you are an interested institutional investor give me a call and join me on the route to discuss the relevant issues.


Let’s see who will be faster: the police or you and me!?


A special thanks goes out to my entire family, my friends, and my girlfriend and her twins. I would like to thank all those who believed in me so far and who supported me from the very first moment when the business idea came to my mind. Especially those who took the risk to be the really early stage investors.


Contact:

@pinkyceo

www.pinkwhy.com

www.facebook.com/pinkwhy


The route:

Day 1: Dessau – Berlin

Day 2: Berlin – Havelberg

Day 3: Havelberg – Boizenburg

Day 4: Boizenburg – Hamburg

Day 5: Hamburg – Verden

Day 6: Verden – Osnabrück

Day 7: Osnabrück – Essen

Day 8: Essen – Duisburg – Düsseldorf – Cologne

Day 9: Cologne – Koblenz

Day 10: Koblenz – Frankfurt

Day 11: Frankfurt – Mannheim

Day 12: Mannheim – Stuttgart

Day 13: Stuttgart – Ulm

Day 14: Ulm – Munich

that the music industry didn't learn. Give people what they want,
when they want it, in the form they want it in, at
a reasonable price – and they'll more likely pay for it rather
than steal it.“
2.  Focus on talented and upcoming
artists of all genres: The majority of art lovers only
focus on big artist. As an art lover you want to be the first one who discovers
a new upcoming artist. Hence it is important to get new artists on the radar as
there are so many fantastic ones are out there waiting to get a chance. Though
we focus the pre-gallery-market to bring structure in it. Like my space does. 
3.  Focus on affordable Artworks (average
artwork below 3.000 Euro): To be honest
- all the Richters, Koons and Hirsts have started as no names. That was the
time when their original artworks were affordable to an even way much bigger
market. The more successful they are the more their value increases. Hence it
is interesting to be one of the first owners for the originals. Also if you are
not a rich customer. 
Okay, many people will now argue
that is better to focus on the expensive products. Well let’s have a look on the
automobile industry. You never buy the prototype. And not every customer can
purchase for example a Lamborghini. Instead the majority of customers can only
achieve e.g. a good Volkswagen. That’s what we focus on. And guess what.
Lamborghini is part of the Volkswagen Group.
4.  Participation on value increase: That’s
another important side effect from the Digitalization & Reproduction
element. Especially for the artist who participates the most on a value
increase. In case you sell reproductions and the original artwork is still on
stock – the sold reproductions are an indicator that there is or will be a
demand for the original artwork. Maybe not at the moment. But the more
reproductions are sold the more the price for the original artwork can
increase. That’s the moment when the Volkswagen becomes a Lamborghini.
When I look
on the USP´s we are a combination of e-commerce and digital media with
influences of a good gallery, Lumas and Jamba/Jamster. Thus I don’t fear other internet art
startups such as Artsy or Amazon´s efforts to become a relevant art trader. What
I am concerned of is the bad experience of other founders with copycats who are
copying good concepts and sometimes are more successful than the original idea.
Hence it is my intent not to face the same experience, and to collect enough
money to be prepared for that challenge. To give a clear idea of what I am
talking about I refer to the invasion of the Normandy. In order to achieve the
overall goal to defeat the Third Reich it was relevant not only to have enough
resources to win a single battle. It was relevant to make sure to have enough
resources in order to win the entire war! 
So far so
good. With focus on collecting money my problems started. I never was able to
raise enough money neither to cover my personal monthly costs nor to shift the
focus on customer acquisition. There were so many people who showed interest to
invest in my idea but who withdraw their interest when it came down to sign the
contract. Though I had to struggle every month to survive and was able to push
the idea only in little steps. Yes, my intend was and is not to start small
like starting as a small gallery. So many galleries face a hard life nowadays.
I want to make advantage out of it by combining it with the internet and the
digital. Nevertheless we have achieved several relevant elements to get start
the company right in the moment we find an investor. The business plan is
written and the concept was reviewed and certified of plausibility by the Chamber of Commerce Halle-Dessau. We also received a certification for “innovative concept”
from the Academic Founders Network Saxony-Anhalt. An expert jury (lawyer, tax
account, bank, and entrepreneur) from the Junior International Club Dessau gave
a general recommendation to investment in the idea. There are also investors
like private family offices and venture capital who would like to invest in a
real Series A round. And we have customers from both; B2B and B2C who are waiting
for our official start.
I, two
other founders, a small team, and two board members are ready to implement the concept
and to demonstrate the proof of concept. Therefore 4 Million Euro are necessary
within the next three years to set up the company and to get the pace which is
relevant to win the battles in the art market. No worries we don’t need the
entire amount at once. I simply want to make sure that we don’t lack on financial support when
we have started. Hence we are currently looking for 50.000 Euro up to 250.000 Euro.
Trouble ahead: Jail is callingNevertheless,
putting all energy and focus on collecting money I lost the most important
aspect. To make people and artists happy. Many investors say they want to
see a founder’s passion and power of endurance. This is my proof. I was also
able to collect money from family, friends and “fools” to get to this point. As mentioned it was never enough to cover my monthly costs. The current situation is as
follows: I have the last 200 Euro in my hands and on next Monday I am going to
lose my apartment and my office if I am not able to collect some money. Therefore
at least 5.000 Euro are necessary to avoid it. Otherwise I am going to be homeless and furthermore to get into jail. This would break my neck.
But this is not going to happen as I am willing
to get to the next point while collecting the necessary amount to start the
company. Because for several weeks now I am struggling with the decision either
to try to move on or to stop all my startup activities and to find a job. I applied
for regular jobs but to be honest: I can’t get the business idea out of my
mind. So I started to think about what kind of other option could be possible.
While thinking through it and writing it down it seems to be an important and
also extraordinary situation. And this requires extraordinary action. Doing
another pitch or being another funding project on a platform? No! Hence it is my
intention to turn this around. It’s important to get on the radar of the right
people. 
As so many
investors stress the fact that they only invest in founders who put the
interests of the company above their own I decided to give proof of exactly this.
I will give proof again of my willingness. An essential quote is on my mind for
almost a year now and which characterizes my personal attitude:
I will always place the
mission first.
I will never accept defeat.
I will never quit.
This is
what I was trained for: As a soldier and officer who completed deployments to
the Kosovo and to Afghanistan. So please investors don’t tell me anymore something
about commitment, responsibility, teamwork, management or even leadership! 
My decision
is still clear: I will move on. For now with a full strategy change as I wasted
too much time to identify potential Business Angels and VC´s and to get access
to them. At least to get a “no interest” or even no reply at all. Or even to
get the runaround with a decision. I don’t care anymore if my idea is not in
your investment focus; or the company generates no profit so far; or you don’t
believe in a specific piece of the entire business plan; or you don’t know me;
or we are just another startup amongst many (the same is vice versa); or you
have a friend in the art sphere who does not believe in the entire business idea
(of course not as we are going to change it); or you simply don’t have the nuts
to take the risk. I don’t want to waste my time any longer. I want to meet the
people whom I haven’t met so far and who want to provide financial support.
Either with a small or a big amount. Every cent counts in large amounts.My plan
And this is
my plan: I will cycle as long as necessary to reach my funding goal. Parallel
there will be a crowd-funding/crowd-investing round.
The cycle
tour is a bit motivated by Forrest Gump´s long run but in this case with some
clear purposes as they are: 
1.  To represent what kind of stresses
and strains entrepreneurs world-wide face every day, 
2.  To raise awareness for founders with
fantastic ideas out there,
3.  To calm down especially the German
uber-Angst of early stage investments and to demonstrate that the German
startup-scene should not be seen as pessimistic as this week’s article from the
Wirtschaftswoche (#wiwo #startup) about the German startup-scene.
First of
all I will get to my state capital Magdeburg to pee on the building which
contains the governmental owned Investment Bank and the Business Angels club. Against
your own mission you are not supportive for the local startup ecosystem.
Stephan Groschupf as the CEO from Datameer.com stressed it on his speech on
last year’s InvestForum in Halle. You guys have the exact attitude as outlined
in the article of the WiWo. My next stops will be Berlin - the German paradise
for founders - then Hamburg, Duesseldorf, Cologne, Frankfurt, Munich. Hopefully
with the goal that I have collected enough money to return to Dessau to start
the company.
To get me
right: I am not running away from my responsibilities. I simply try to find
another option between jail and committing suicide! Both are not really scaring
me. And both are no proper solution. Because inside I am still highly motivated
to get my idea become reality.
Your support:Now is the
moment where you come in and this is my deal offer: If this story is worth and
you would like to support me, share the post and donate minimum five Euro. Take it as a lottery. In case
the company will be founded you will get a share on my company according to the
donated amount or on whatever you supported me during my journey (see the route
below). I am also happy when you support me with a place to sleep, a shower or
something to eat. A RedBull from time to time would be a highlight. (Hey RedBull,
will you support me with some drinks? PS: Founders need more then pizza and
coffee. They need energy!)
If you are an
interested institutional investor give me a call and join me on the route to
discuss the relevant issues. 
Let’s see
who will be faster: the police or you and me!?
A special
thanks goes out to my entire family, my friends, and my girlfriend and her
twins. I would like to thank all those who believed in me so far and who
supported me from the very first moment when the business idea came to my mind.
Especially those who took the risk to be the really early stage investors.Contact:@pinkyceowww.pinkwhy.comwww.facebook.com/pinkwhyThe route: 
Day 1: Dessau – Berlin
Day 2: Berlin – Havelberg
Day 3: Havelberg – Boizenburg
Day 4: Boizenburg – Hamburg
Day 5: Hamburg – Verden
Day 6: Verden – Osnabrück
Day 7: Osnabrück – Essen
Day 8: Essen – Duisburg – Düsseldorf – Cologne
Day 9: Cologne – Koblenz
Day 10: Koblenz – Frankfurt
Day 11: Frankfurt – Mannheim
Day 12: Mannheim – Stuttgart
Day 13: Stuttgart – Ulm

Day 14: Ulm – Munich

story:
We are Houston artists who are taking on a big problem in our community: gentrification. Most of us are impoverished and fairly broke most of the time, just like  others in the low-income neighborhoods where we live. Frequently, big, yellow machines with great claws destroy our houses and also our neighbors' houses, and then we have to leave, if we can find somewhere to go. But wherever we go, the big machines follow us and chase us away again, along with our new neighbors. This is a Houston story. It is an American story. It is a global story. We are raising money to put on a huge event that will fund radical alternatives to gentrification through collective action. The Big Machine will support The Hardy Yards community garden, and also some local artists whose bodies lie in the path of these big machines.


The Big Machine is a reflection on gentrification and human displacement. The artists will bring into question the artist’s role in this process. The Big Machine explores the power of artists to react, question, and subvert the process of gentrification. The Big Machine features an alternate socialistic economy for how contributions will be distributed. Art will be sold at auction on a 75/25 split favoring the artist. After expenses are met, remaining proceeds will be divided equally among all participating artists/performers.


Goal: $1375


* Make sure all non-commercial artists get compensated for showing their art, even if it doesn’t sell at auction.


Expenses:

  • Lighting 250
  • Tables 250

  • Hardware 75

  • Documentation 300

  • Refreshments 300

  • Trash Cans 40

  • Curator 75

  • Trash Bags 30

  • Markers/Posters/Tape 55



If art does not thrive, the community does not thrive. If we are to take on the problem of gentrification, we must begin with our own role in the process. Artists love our neighborhoods, and we want them to be strong. The Big Machine brings us all together, in collective action, to support our neighborhoods while also recognizing that artists have expenses to pay rent, buy food, and make art. Collective action empowers people and neighborhoods. Artists are not powerless over poverty, and neighborhoods are not powerless over gentrification. We are helping to empower artists and neighborhoods into developing radical alternatives to gentrification and human displacement.


It is possible that we will make very little money, and artists might only collect pennies for their share. It is possible that we will not make very much for the Hardy Yards, either. But it is certain that we will make great art and set up a big ruckus and raise consciousness all around.


Images of Perks:

Perk 4, "Blooming" by Jonatan Lopez


Perk 5, "Of Mapplethorn" by Chris Comperry


Perk 7

Custom Made Picnic




Perk 8, "The Move" by Thien Ho



Perk 10, "Feathered Breast" by Caitlin Scott



Perk 11, "Rx-Rx" by Emmanuel Nuno Arambula
