story:
OUR STORY

We are in an exciting phase !

Pepatian has performance and film projects that are ready to be presented at other communities and need additional support to create marketing materials in order to reach those communities in the college/university, high school and community centers. We are also asking for support to launch an archival and documentation project to make existing video materials more accessible.

Projects include:

1) BRONX HIP-HOP ACADEMY

Teaching artists: Rokafella, Caridad De La Luz/La Bruja, Toofly, DP One, and Fred Sepulveda

We are in the middle of a magical year at BronxWorks.

Our workshop series culminates in a final performance to friends, families and supporters. We are ready to explore taking the Hip-Hop Academy to other young people.  Your support will help pay for design and photographer fees to help us make beautiful materials ! As well as pay for zip-up lightweight tops for staff to wear at the concluding performance. ($600)

2) SHADOW LANDS

Collaborating artists: Caridad De La Luz/La Bruja (poet and singer) and Cynthia Paniagua (dancer)

Shadow Lands is a collaboration that explores feminine prowess and vulnerabilities through a surreal navigation of the female psyche, released through movement, music, comedy and poetry.

The artists premiered the work at Pregones Theater in June 2013 and are preparing to work with artist and choreographer Teresa Hernandez in Puerto Rico this summer to create another presentation on la isla. The artists are working on strengthening the work so its ready to engage with other communities.  Your support will help pay for photographer and design fees for a brochure that will outline the performance project and also workshops that the collaborating artists can provide to young people. ($300)

3) OUT OF LA NEGRURA/Out of Blackness

Collaborating artist: Sita Frederick, Ana “Rokafella” Garcia, Marion Ramirez

Film Editor: Naeema Jamilah

Out of La Negrura/Out of Blackness will be a 40-minute documentary film based on a dance theater project created over five years which explored Caribbean/Latina-American experience through dance. Emerging film editor Naeema Jamilah is sculpting the work into an engaging interplay of live clips and interviews with the performing artists. She has completed a rough draft of 10minutes and will be working on the remainder over Summer 2014.

Our aim is to create a strong and engaging film that could also serve as a platform for the artists to offer workshops and performances as well as audience discussions about making the work. The film increases the potential to reach and inspire audiences in other locations and supports the potential for the artists to tour with the film.

The intended audience is college and universities with Dance, Hip-Hop, as well as Cultural/Performance/Latino-American/Caribbean/Women/Urban Studies Departments.  Additionally the film could also be shown at high schools and community centers. Your support will help pay design fees to pull together the marketing “look” of the documentary.  ($300)

4) PEPATIAN ARCHIVES

Pepatian has a backlog of VHS tapes of previous performances that need to be transferred to DVD. We are going to begin collaborating with a media expert who has the equipment and experience to help transfer and organize the years of documentary material. Your support will help us launch the first phase of this archival project. ($300).

THE IMPACT

These projects are very important to the artists involved and to Pepatian’s ability to engage with other communities within and outside of the Bronx, New York.  Your support with our efforts to produce strong materials will help us gain the attention of the college and university markets, as well as local high schools and community centers for potential future gigs and touring.

WHAT YOU GET

Credit on Pepatian Spring 2014 programs and announcement on Facebook

Opportunity to meet with the Artists and Artistic/General Director over coffee.

A one-of-a-kind Pepatian t-shirt that proclaims: "Find Your Inner Bronx" !

Free tickets to Pepatian performance, Saturday June 28, 2014.

WE NEED YOU

We need your help at this critical time to stay on track and support the artists and keep these projects moving forward.   www.pepatian.org

Feel free to share this call for support (facebook, twitter, email) with your friends and supporters -- we appreciate your help!    

!!! THANK YOU GRACIAS THANKS!!!

story:
My name is Brent Solomon, and I need your help in putting together an extraordinary show—my first in New York. I also need your help in getting my mom there in time to see it all happen.

I'd like to believe that Patti Smith was wrong when she said that New York was closed off to the young and struggling. Visibility is paramount in this day and age, and I believe everyone, not just designers + artists, has something to contribute to the design process. 

Seguing back to Patti Smith, one can definitely find truth in her statement—NYC is expensive. I'm sure everyone has heard of the "young, creative professional with big dreams coming from a small city—"

Well, I'm from Houston. So it has been instilled in my nature to dream as big as our hair (Or steaks. You get it.)—this is what has cultivated since my upbringing and into the moments leading up to my IndieGoGo registration and email confirmation. 

I need to believe that I am able bring a vision to life—from development, funding, and into completion—and then into recognition—and then into the possibilities of whatever opportunities may likely be presented, as a result of the collective support from people like you. As PBS as it sounds, my intentions ring true.


THE CAMPAIGN

Project Scope:

  • $300 will fund the labor and delivery of custom CNC-milled parts for Flesh—of which I have narrowed down to a list of local companies that are able to provide reasonable costs and turnaround times—and then having it packaged and delivered to my work place, where it will be manually assembled.
  • $100 will go towards three (3) large format, digital prints, of which I will be sending off to a Houston company that provides rates exponentially cheaper than what I've found in NYC—and will be framed and showcased in conjunction with my 3D work.
  • $80-100 will go towards event promotion including, but not limited to: business cards, personal flyers, and information pamphlets—which will provide further information regarding the collection, for those attending.
  • $200 will cover limo services to pick up my mom from LaGuardia Airport promptly at 9:00 PM to get her to the event—because being a stupid idiot, I gave her the wrong time to fly in, leaving only a small window of opportunity for her to make it in time for the show. The funds will also cover additional services of holding luggage + waiting for the duration of the event, as I wouldn't dare make my poor mother haul her belongings down the streets of New York on her first night. Seriously, what kind of son does that make me?


WHAT IS RAW?

RAW:natural born artists is an international independent arts organization that hand-selects and spotlights independent creatives in visual art, film, fashion, music, hair & makeup artistry, photography, models and performing art.

RAW's mission is to provide up-and-coming artists of all creative realms with the tools, resources and exposure needed to inspire and cultivate creativity so that they might be seen, heard and loved. RAW educates, connects and exposes emerging artists in over 60 artistic communities across the United States, Australia, Canada and the U.K. through monthly showcase events. Join us in celebrating the work of these artists.


WHAT CAN I EXPECT?

RAW events are multi-faceted artistic showcases. Each event features a film screening, musical performance, fashion show, art gallery, performance art and a featured hairstylist and makeup artist. These artists are all local, hand-picked talent who have been chosen to feature at RAW.

RAW events feature a cash bar for cocktails while you enjoy the night. Dress code is cocktail attire, so dress the occasion and get ready for an artistic circus of creativity!


WAYS TO HELP:

If you're a stickler for options and are compelled to support my cause through alternative means, here are three!

1) Register for tickets through my profile: (http://www.rawartists.org/brentsolomon) 

Even though you don't plan on attending, each purchase goes towards me meeting my ticket quota!

2) On October 1st, online voting begins for RAWards 2013, in which you'll be able to vote me into a pool of finalists from all over the country, and then who knows.

3) If all of this self-promotion isn't annoying enough, join the Event Page on Facebook, where I will be tracking + updating the status of this and everything this-related!

Project Scope:


$300 will fund the labor and delivery of custom CNC-milled parts for Flesh—of which I have narrowed down to a list of local companies that are able to provide reasonable costs and turnaround times—and then having it packaged and delivered to my work place, where it will be manually assembled.


$100 will go towards three (3) large format, digital prints, of which I will be sending off to a Houston company that provides rates exponentially cheaper than what I've found in NYC—and will be framed and showcased in conjunction with my 3D work.

$80-100 will go towards event promotion including, but not limited to: business cards, personal flyers, and information pamphlets—which will provide further information regarding the collection, for those attending.

$200 will cover limo services to pick up my mom from LaGuardia Airport promptly at 9:00 PM to get her to the event—because being a stupid idiot, I gave her the wrong time to fly in, leaving only a small window of opportunity for her to make it in time for the show. The funds will also cover additional services of holding luggage + waiting for the duration of the event, as I wouldn't dare make my poor mother haul her belongings down the streets of New York on her first night. Seriously, what kind of son does that make me?






WHAT IS RAW?

RAW:natural born artists is an international independent arts organization that hand-selects and spotlights independent creatives in visual art, film, fashion, music, hair & makeup artistry, photography, models and performing art.
RAW's mission is to provide up-and-coming artists of all creative realms with the tools, resources and exposure needed to inspire and cultivate creativity so that they might be seen, heard and loved. RAW educates, connects and exposes emerging artists in over 60 artistic communities across the United States, Australia, Canada and the U.K. through monthly showcase events. Join us in celebrating the work of these artists.

WHAT CAN I EXPECT?

RAW events are multi-faceted artistic showcases. Each event features a film screening, musical performance, fashion show, art gallery, performance art and a featured hairstylist and makeup artist. These artists are all local, hand-picked talent who have been chosen to feature at RAW.
RAW events feature a cash bar for cocktails while you enjoy the night. Dress code is cocktail attire, so dress the occasion and get ready for an artistic circus of creativity!

WAYS TO HELP:
If you're a stickler for options and are compelled to support my cause through alternative means, here are three!

1) Register for tickets through my profile: (http://www.rawartists.org/brentsolomon) 
Even though you don't plan on attending, each purchase goes towards me meeting my ticket quota!
2) On October 1st, online voting begins for RAWards 2013, in which you'll be able to vote me into a pool of finalists from all over the country, and then who knows.


3) If all of this self-promotion isn't annoying enough, join the Event Page on Facebook, where I will be tracking + updating the status of this and everything this-related!

story:
Summary of our journey home from BRC

Burning Man Caravansary 2014 was a great burn. On the 21st we loaded up Big Red (1996 Dodge Ram 2500 8L V10) with our art, The Supreme Ultimate, and headed out to BRC. The drive down was exuberant with excitement building for the burn, our art and the stories we would bring back home. The burn went great, we erected our art over the weekend. The rest of the week was spent exploring, making new friends, and enjoying the burn to the fullest extent. The morning of the 30th, we burned The Supreme Ultimate at sunrise and that afternoon we packed camp into Big Red and headed out that night. Big Red was a strong runner, tough as a team of mules, and ready to tackle any big job. Little did we know that Big Red was ready to call it quits. We headed north on 447, it was late and we settled in for a long drive back to Tri-Cities, WA, about 9 hours away. 

60 Miles into the journey Big Red was starting to make strange noises. We pulled over and found a loose wire on the battery and thought that might be the issue. We managed to get it running again with the batteries used to power lights for The Supreme Ultimate and a length of speaker wire (Radical Self-Reliance at its best). We traveled down the road another 7 or so miles when Big Red started to overheat and started making sounds that no engine should make. We pulled off to the side of 447 as best we could and lifted the hood to find an enormous amount of coolant and oil spewed every which way.. After an hour or so of desperation and helplessness, a wonderful couple of burners from Vancouver, BC, stopped and offered to help. They drove me into Cedarville in which I could finally get cell phone coverage and managed to procure a tow truck from Alturas, CA. 

I finally made it back to the Big Red and my stranded friends about 2.5 hours later where I found them eating Pickles and drinking Capt'n Morgan.. We got Big Red loaded and towed him back to Alturas. Every hotel in town was booked. An angel appeared in the shape of a Tow Truck Driver. Alan from Pioneer Auto invited us to his house where he lets us bunk in his 5th wheel and offered us showers and coffee in the morning. We went to the garage where we jumped Big Red. Alan immediately noted the gurgling of the coolant into the overflow reservoir, more than likely a cracked head or a blown head gasket.  

Around noon, I managed to get my folks to drive down from WA State to pick all of us up. No garages would be open until after the Labor Day holiday and we had to get home to the default world to take care of our families and jobs. We left Big Red in Cali and drove home reaching Tri-Cities at 3am on Monday morning. This morning, Tuesday the 2nd of Sept I received a call from Ronnie at Ron Campbell Automotive that Big Red has biten the dust and is in need of a new engine.

What We Need 

Breakdown of what is needed:

  • Used/Rebuilt Engine - Ronnie has found one from a reputable company that has around 80k miles on it for $2000.
  • Shop charges - Ron will charge us $1500 to install the engine.
  • Travel Expenses - $700 To get back down to Alturas, CA to pick-up Big Red and pay for fuel to get Big Red home. 

Big Red needs a new heart, and the cost of towing it, fixing it and bringing her back home is much more money than I currently have. Burning Man is an expensive endeavor and most of my expendable cash flow is depleted.

  • Big Red is a Burner. He wants to be able to make it back to BRC with more art in 2015 and beyond.
  • I've never asked for monetary donations like this, but the financial burden Big Red is placing on us is very tough to manage at this time.
  • Big Red belongs to my Step-Father, the responsibility of the financial aspect has fallen into my lap and that's why I'm asking for help.
If you can help Big Red be resurrected I would forever be grateful to you. After going to Burning Man, I always leave with a renewed faith in the graciousness of others. I would love to bring more art back to the Playa for others to enjoy and I need Big Red to make that happen. Please help the best you can and remember anything helps.
Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, tell all your burner friends. I know we can make this work, I believe!

Thank You

Oz

story:
“Wooden Wars” – a new multilingual play about Polish-Jewish relationships by Jana Mazurkiewicz

During my academic studies I developed a strong interest in the “rejected daughter of Jewish culture” - Yiddish theatre. I would like to contribute to its rich tradition by staging a multilingual play that I wrote, The main language of the play is Yiddish, in addition to English and Polish. The title of the play is “Wooden Wars” and it comments on Polish-Jewish relationships in contemporary Poland.

As a Yiddishist, I am devoted to rescuing the dying Yiddish language and culture. I would like to demonstrate that Yiddish can be revived not only in academia but also in the arts. I also strive to encourage a discussion about a revival of Yiddish as a stage language and as a mean of exploring the current state of Polish-Jewish relationships. I expect to attract audiences from a wide range of backgrounds: Polish, Polish-American, Jewish, non-Jewish, general theatre enthusiasts, and students of the University of Michigan.

The Story

“Wooden Wars” focuses on the lives of four young Catholics from modern Poland, each of whom changes forever when they discover that they might have Jewish roots. Sisters Zosia and Ania separate as one travels to America, converts to reform Judaism, and embraces her lesbian sexuality, while the other stays behind in Poland and marries a Chabadnik. Both come to speak Yiddish at home. Their stories are intertwined with those of their friends Jakub and Tadek, two young men whose own relationships with Jewish identity and Yiddish language are troubled. Neither as children nor as adults do the characters have control of their fates. Various paranormal forces are involved in the action, and Jesus appears to sings in Yiddish.

The Title

The title “Wooden Wars” refers to a cultural battle in contemporary Poland that’s highlighted in the play by two symbolic wooden artifacts: wooden crosses, and wooden figurines of Jews. These figurines, made of wood or clay, are a part of contemporary Polish culture. People buy them as amulets believing that they will bring happiness to their households. This article explains their meaning: http://www.vice.com/en_ca/read/hey-poland-whats-up-with-those-lucky-jew-statues

The Languages

“Wooden Wars” starts in English and Polish, but gradually includes more Yiddish so that by the second act almost all of the performance is in Yiddish. This structure asks us to reflect: Is Yiddish the key to understanding the Polish-Jewish past? For the audience’s ease, an English translation will also be projected as subtitles.

Main goals of the project

• Initiating the collaboration between different communities at the University of Michigan
• Promoting creativity in Yiddish
• Encouraging people to involve in the arts
• Enhancing Polish–Jewish dialogue

The $5000 I raise is needed to stage the play (at least 4 performances) in a fully professional way and to record it on video. 

Your contribution goes towards:

  • Props
  • Scenography
  • Costumes
  • Sound Design
  • Light, Sound, Set
  • Posters and programs
  • Opening night
  • Recording on video
  • Editing the video
  • If you donate $10, I'll teach you a Yiddish curse word that you'll NEVER FORGET!
  • If you donate $25, you'll get your name printed in the opening night program. 
  • If you donate $100, I'll give you up to 3 hours of Yiddish lessons plus you will get a "thank you" picture of the cast emailed to you. 
  • If you donate $500, you'll get your name printed in the opening night program and in I'll inscribe it in the the video credits personally thanking you for your support.
  • If donate $1000 or more, I will dedicate my performance and my video to you and I'll give you a copy of the video, personally autographed by me.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please, pass this along to all your friends and family! Help Yiddish be a stage language again! :)

story:
THORBIRD'S ART

Less than a year ago, it was discovered that Richard possesses a treasure trove of over 150 paintings dating back to the mid-60′s thru the late 70′s.  His exquisite art seems as if pulled from a time-capsule, yet the imagery somehow remains contemporary.  This revelation makes the re-introduction of Richard Thorbird to the art world and the 21st century thrilling for us and the inevitable next step in helping to save his home.  We could not be more proud or excited to present these hidden gems to the public for the first time.

Born in 1937, Richard Thorstenson (A.K.A. Thor, Thorbird, Ricardo Montalblonde or just Montalblonde) is originally from Duluth, Minnesota. With a degree in Art from the University of Minnesota, Richard packed up his 1940 Chevy hot-rod and headed west to Topanga Canyon at the beginning of the counter-cultural revolution. Over the following decade and half, amidst the bohemian enclave of artists gathering in Southern California, Thorbird made hundreds of paintings, scraping together a living by selling them to friends, celebrities, and local characters straight from his home. We believe they embody not only the unique vision of a genuine talent, but the essence of California’s golden age, and its spirit of creative, sexual, and psychedelic discovery.

THE DRIVE TO SAVE THORBIRD'S HOME

Richard's home in Topanga Canyon is in foreclosure due to a series of unfortunate events (none of which Richard will allow himself to feel victimized by). Richard is 78 years old, has no family, and is isolated from the world because of his age and poor health. Without family or funds, if he doesn’t come up with $17,500 by April 30th, he will become homeless and will quite literally lose everything. The bank will repossess Richard’s small home and take away a lifetime of earnest hard work and creativity.

We’re making this effort and doing what we’re doing because Richard is one of us and, quite simply, he is worth it.  We firmly believe that as a society, we must continue to place value on special individuals like Richard who inspire us creatively and  as human beings.  We are all in this effort together, as a group of young artists, and are rallying to help him raise this money.  Richard’s struggle is not unique, but he is -- we truly appreciate the gold he shares and reflects back to us all. 

THE FUTURE FOR RICHARD

The goal of this campaign is two-fold: 1) In the next two weeks we are seeking to preserve the roof over Richard’s head by setting up a living trust from these campaign funds;  2) In the process, we will introduce Richard’s artwork to the public so that it can help provide him with a sustainable revenue stream moving forward. 

 After we save his home, we are planning a formalized showing in Los Angeles of Richard's paintings - a vast body of work created between 1964 and 1978. The ultimate hope is that we help establish an appreciation & interest in the art, so that Richard never has to fear domestic foreclosure again. Of course, Thorbird himself is worth such an endeavor, but moreover, we believe his artwork -- heretofore unknown to the general public -- will be highly praised and valued as it is revealed. 

You can view more of Richard's work here: Richard Thorbird.  

If you are interested in a painting that is not for sale on this indiegogo page, please email Andrew ( andrew@invisiblegraffiti.com ) directly for prices and availability.  

Follow @savethorbird on instagram for more about Richard's paintings.

******UPDATE*******

We are happy to announce a showing of Thorbird's work at "the otheroom" on Abbot Kinney in Venice, CA.  There will be an opening on MAY 29th, 2015, and the collection will be on display through June 26th. 

*********************


THE PERKS

PRINTS AND POSTCARDS


MYSTERY PERK
Richard's pop-culture memorabilia collection is to die for.  If you select *Mystery Perk* you will receive a little piece of  Richard to remind you to find humor in the puzzles life throws at you, and to always, always retain and live with that wonderful state of play that children know so well and the happiest adults never forget.    

PAINTINGS

"Why You Can't Tell" (1971)  -- 36" x 36"  acrylic on canvas                                   ** Find out how to own it on Instagram  @savethorbird**


"The Age of Self" (1970) -- 24" x 36"  acrylic on canvas                                          ** Find out how to own it on Instagram  @savethorbird**


Painting #1 - "Thor's Tomahawk"  (1966) -- 20" x 20"  acrylic on canvas


Painting #2 - "Flora Fidget" (1964) -- 12" x 24" acrylic on canvas


Lithograph #3 - "Elementary School" (1975) -- 19"x30" edition of 2 - 2 available



Painting #4 - "March Ides" (1969) -- 18" x 24" acrylic on canvas


Painting #5 - "Beatnik" (1968) -- 36" x 36" acrylic on canvas



Painting #6  - "Leroy" (1973)  -- 24" x 24"  acrylic on canvas


Painting #7  --"The End of an Era" (1968)  -- 36" x 36"  acrylic on canvas


Painting #8 - "Clovis" (1976) -- 40" x 48"  acrylic on canvas


Painting # 9 - "Asterisk" (1968)  -- 36" x 36"  acrylic on canvas



Painting # 10 - "Moon in June" (1969)  -- 36" x 36"  acrylic on canvas


Painting #11 - "Alifie" (1974)  -- 24" x 36"  acrylic on canvas


Painting #12 - "Last Straw" (1969)  -- 36" x 36"  acrylic on canvas


Painting #13 - "Canción de Julieta" (1970) -- 36" x 36" acrylic on canvas


Painting #14-"To Carla, Marsha & Caroline" (1972)  24" x 36"  acrylic on canvas

You can view more of Richard's work here: Richard Thorbird.  

If you are interested in a painting that is not for sale on this indiegogo page, please email Andrew ( andrew@invisiblegraffiti.com ) directly for prices and availability.

story:
Scroll down for English version

WO IST DER BLOCH? Vermisst Du ihn auch?

DIE GERÜCHTE

Die Gerüchteküche brodelt. Flog er davon, weil er in heisser Liebe zum Fernsehturm entbrannte? Zog er im Herbst mit den Vögeln fort und wanderte auf eine tropische Insel aus?  "Verpixelte“ er nach den abertausenden, digitalen Fotoaufnahmen und verschwand in der virtuellen Realität ? 

DIE WAHRHEIT

Die Wahrheit ist, dass seine zehnjährigen täglichen Auftritte bei Wind und Wetter, als Hausdrache und Maskottchen des Hauses Schwarzenberg, ihren Tribut gefordert haben.

Der Bloch liegt mechanisch ausgelaugt in der Monsterwerkstatt.

Das Haus Schwarzenberg ist nicht mehr dasselbe ohne seinen Freund und Maskottchen. Der Bloch war eine wundervolle, ungeheuerliche Attraktion für viele Besucher aus aller Welt.

DIE GUTE NACHRICHT

...ist: Du kannst uns helfen den Bloch zurück zu holen!

BUDGET/ ZEITPLAN

Der BLOCH braucht eine Generalüberholung. Hannes wird mindestens einen Monat brauchen ihn wieder instand zu setzen.

Der Bloch bekommt einen neuen Rüssel, neue Gelenke, ein neues Druckluftsystem, eine neue Aussenhaut, damit er in eine goldene Zukunft schauen kann und seine Betrachter begeistern kann.

Dein Geld wird die Materialien, die Arbeit und ein sicheres Standbein für den BLOCH finanzieren.

ZUVIEL GELD IST NIE ZUVIEL ;)

Jedes zusätzliche Geld wird die Arbeit des Haus Schwarzenberg  fördern.

ANDERE WEGE ZU HELFEN

Es gibt mehr als nur diesen einen Weg uns zu helfen, den Bloch wiederzubringen!!

Teile diese Kampagne mit Freunden, Kollegen, Kunden und Journalisten. Verlinke uns in deinem sozialen Netzwerk, Blog oder auf deiner Webseite.

1000 Dank!

PERKS

Hier ist unser Entwurf für die BBBloch-Münze. Es wird davon nur 500 Exemplare geben!Wenn Ihr eins haben möchtet,spendet jetzt!


english version:

WHERE IS THE BLOCH?  Do you miss him too?

RUMOURS

Rumours abound. Has he flown off to fall in love with the TV tower? Did he join the birds in autumn and migrate to a tropical island? After many thousands of camera shots, has he finally pixelated and entered a virtual reality?

TRUTH

Here's the truth. 10 years of daily performances at Haus Schwarzenberg have taken their toll and he has retreated to the Monsterkabinett workshop in a state of mechanical exhaustion.

The Haus Schwarzenberg hasn’t been the same without our mascot and friend. He was an beloved attraction for many visitors from all over the world.

GOOD NEWS

The good news is that you can help us bring BLOCH back.

BUDGET/ TIMELINE

Hannes will need at least a month to put BLOCH back together.

BLOCH requires general reconstruction and modernization.

He also needs a new trunk, re-enforcement, a new pneumatic system and body work so he can grace us with his presence for many years to come.

Your money will finance the materials, the work and the administration to create a sure footing for the BLOCH.

THERE IS NEVER ENOUGH MONEY ;)

Any extra contributions will further the work of Haus Schwarzenberg .

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

There is more than one way to help us help BLOCH !

Share this campaign with your friends, colleagues, customers  and journalists on your favourite social media platforms or publishing it on your blog.

Thank you !

PERKS

 Here is the design for our BBBloch coin. there will only be 500 pieces minted .

 when you would like to have one donate now !

story:
Who Are You Guys?

We are a team of high school students with a passion for charity, art, and engineering. As part of our community service cirriculum, we build and race sculptures in the Kinetic Grand Championship and raise money for Betty Chinn's charity.

  • This will be our fourth year racing.
  • We have raised over $700 for Betty, and donated countless socks and cans of food.
  • Betty is very successful in our community, recently recognized with a Presidential Citizens medal from Barack Obama.

Every dollar we receive will be used to help us race for Betty.

What We Need

This year, we are trying to "do it right". The first year we raced, our sculpture was nothing but two bikes welded together, braced with conduit and duct tape. The second year, we overcompensated and built a frame out of 2" water pipe that was at a minimum three times overly heavy and strong for our two pilots. All we could find at the junk yard were three differently sized motorcycle tires.

The third year, we realized that there were reasons the other team's sculptures were built the way they were-

  • They wanted speed and lightweight construction
  • They had money

We wanted the first and didn't have the second. We solicited donations from local businesses and were fortunate to be given enough metal to build a light and fast sculpture. We fundraised and scrounged the junk yard for other parts, managing to build a much improved sculpture for less than $450.

This year, we are at it once again. Our welders have been busy refurbishing last year's frame and our art team has designed a Roman Chariot theme for our new art. We have been fundraising, but we have large goals. Our most experienced welders and engineers are graduating this year and they want to build a sculpture that will last after they leave. The most complicated and maintenance-intense part of the sculpture are the bike parts that we use to drive the machine, something that we have to upgrade if the sculpture is going to last past this year.

Any money we raise here will be spent on

  • Two new mountain bikes that will give us reliable speed changes and durability for future years
  • A high quality coat of paint for the frame
  • Incidental costs 

What You Get

We have some pretty cool perks, if I might say so myself:

  • Anyone who donates will get their names stamped into the frame, to be seen by generations to come.
  • $30 and above can send us a logo, either personal or business, that will be prominently displayed on the machine.
  • $100 and above will receive an artfully made, steel horse and chariot.

The Impact

Our project has real benefits both to the homeless of our community and local students. Our sculpture took fist place in the county Industrial Arts show last year, at the same time donating more that $300 to Betty Chinn.

 

If You Can't Donate

  • Please help us out by sharing this on your Facebook, Twitter, etc.

story:
** Hello lovely people visiting us after the 23rd of December 2014! All the information below is still correct, except for shipping estimates and shipping costs. As of 2015, orders are subject to a £25 shipping fee and will likely take 10-12 weeks to reach you from the time we receive your measurements, but we will keep you posted**

Hi. Hello. Welcome!  We are Matilde, Daniel and Sara and together we are B'atz'. We believe in connecting communities through culture and creativity, and hope you will be as inspired by our vision as we are. We're passionate about Guatemala's beautiful textile art and turn it into unique boots and bags that will have a positive impact not just on your wardrobe, but on all the hands that have come together to weave, embroider, stitch and love them to life.

B’atz’ means “thread” in the Mayan language Kaqchikel. It is the thread of life that unites all living things, and in daily life it is the thread that is used to weave the beautiful traditional textiles that are a great source of pride here in Guatemala. These threads tie each of us to our communities and cultures all over the world, but they also connect us to each other through bridges that allow us to share skills and inspiration. B’atz’ is about building these bridges so that talented local artisans can share their gifts and you can invest in ethically and beautifully handcrafted works of art to wear with pride. 

***Please see the gallery (last tab, top of page) for more lovely photos***


Why?

Women are at the heart of Guatemala's vibrant textile culture, and also of what we do here at B’atz’. We believe women have the potential to be powerful agents of revolutionary change in their communities. With the opportunity to earn a sustainable living and share their talents with a wider audience, this potential can be unleashed. We are supporting this process by linking hands with talented women weavers, and are inviting you to join our network by taking our hand and investing in our vision.

How?

We are bringing this vision to life by creating partnerships based on mutual respect and cooperation, and harnessing the power of these partnerships as paths to prosperity. We believe in strengthening people’s own ability to catalyse change in their communities and are currently in the process of teaming up with a microloan provider here in Guatemala. We will soon be ready to begin re-investing a portion of our proceeds in microloans that will fund women’s innovative small business ideas all over Guatemala.


What we need

We operate under a grassroots artisanal philosophy, meaning that every stage of production is completed entirely by hand, requiring great skill and creativity. All materials, down to shoelaces, buttons and rubber sole protectors are purchased from local small businesses. The fabrics we use are woven thread by thread by women in the Sololá region of Guatemala, with some patterns taking over a month to complete. As we expand, we hope to be able to join hands with more artisans in more communities, strengthening our network, amplifying our impact and bringing you many more beautiful textiles to choose from in the future.

The funds we raise on this campaign will go towards:

·  Fulfillment – making sure you get your perks and that they are of our signature high quality.

·  Expanding our texile network – we will be seeking out more women weavers who want to share their talents with the world.

·  Tools – we need to invest in new workshop tools so we can keep making high-quality beautiful products for a long time to come.

·  Building our website so we can continue to invest, empower and inspire!

·  Funding our first microloans – exciting!

Our goal for this project is £2,500. This is the minimum we need to get up and running, and so we have picked the "fixed funding" model, meaning that we must meet our goal in order to access any funds raised. We also have 2 stretch goals:

·  £3,000 – it’s not much more but this little bit extra will allow us to do many more things, such as developing lots of new styles to offer you in the next few months.

·  £7,000 – Whoa! Incredible! With this kind of investment we could really grow. We would be able to rent a workshop space all of our own, and hire more talented artisans eager to share their talents.



The Good Stuff


All of the prices quoted here on or Indiegogo page are our starter sale prices - so grab 'em while they're discounted! Here is a breakdown of our lovely boots and bags and how to order them:

We are currently working with 3 different textiles:

                Maria                              Catarina                             Luisa


And 3 different tones of leather:

                  Café                                 Árbol                                Tinte


There are 2 flexible styles of boot - Doblado Boot and Ankle Bootie. Plus 1 flexible style of bagpack (it’s both a bag and a backpack!) - Mochila. "Flexible” means that you can design your very own by choosing which leather and fabric combinations inspire you. 


     Doblado  Boot                   Ankle Bootie                     Doblado Boot

     (Café & Catarina)                      (Tinte & Catarina)                         (Árbol & Luisa)


               Mochila - as shoulder bag           Mochila - as backpack

                                                                   (Café & Maria)

We also have a fixed style of handbag - Morralito - which comes in 2 different colour combos - Tierra and Colibri.  The textiles in these beauties are totally unique and we have a very limited number of each - 10 of Tierra and 5 of Colibri.

              Morralito (Tierra)                                                       Morralito (Colibri)

                   
Lastly, we have some lovely Arcoiris bracelets on offer for those of you who aren't ready for boots or a bag just yet. We had a lot of fun making these bracelets and love them so much we wanted to keep them for ourselves! They come in many different colours and no two are alike.




****Please go to the gallery (last tab, top of the page) for more pictures***

Sizing

We know buying shoes online can be intimidating, and we're here to make it as easy as possible. Crafting boots by hand is a complex process, but our talented partner artisans are experts and every pair is custom-fitted - even when you're on the other side of the world! Once you have placed your order, we will be in touch and explain how to send us your size. All you will need is a sheet of A4 paper, a pen, a tape-measure and a scanner.


What next?

If you have chosen one of our shoulder bags - Tierra or Colibri - simply claim your perk and you're ready to go. The colour combos for these bags are already fixed.

If you have chosen the Ankle Bootie, Doblado Boot or Mochila we will be in touch to confirm which of the 3 leathers and which of the 3 fabrics you would like. Be creative and go for whatever inspires you!

If you have chosen an Arcoiris bracelet (or 2!) then we will be in touch and give you a selection of those available to choose from.

If you have picked the "You're in Charge" perk, then we're really excited to meet you (virtually at least) and work together to make your perfect boots/bag!


* Please remember that all the materials we work with are hand-woven, hand-embroidered, hand-stitched and hand-dyed. Slight variaions in tone, colour and pattern are possible, celebrate them! We make all of our products sustainably, slowly and with love, so each has it's own unique spirit - just like you!


Spread the word!

Whether you are able to contribute or not, you can still share our story on social media and help us get the word out. Tell your friends about us and help us to grow!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/batzboots

Twitter: https://twitter.com/Batz_Boots

Tumblr: http://batz-boots.tumblr.com

Instagram: @batz_boots

story:
The Story

Recurring John is a new song cycle premiering  in the concert series at Summerworks.  In this debut of his first complete musical theatre work, up-and-coming lyricist/composer Kevin Wong explores what can be discovered about one man, through the eyes of those closest to him. With a cast of seven and a six-piece band, RECURRING JOHN tells the story of John from the perspective of his mother, co-worker, friends and many others. Each song gives the audience a unique perspective on how the actions of one person can affect so many others. Directed by Jeff Madden, this show is an exciting new take on the contemporary song cycle, and is sure to appeal to musical theatre fans.

What We Need & What You Get

It takes a village to put on a show like this and we need your help. With your contribution, we will be able to present Recurring John at it's full potential, with a cast of extraordinary performers, and an amazing band.  In addition to providing you with the best possible show, we will be able to offer our cast and crew the best experience possible. Your assistance will help, create set pieces, rent equipment, and ensure that our team is paid the way they deserve to be. Any dollar helps! Take a look at our perks to see what those dollars can get you! Who doesn't want a private concert from Kevin Wong and Chris Tsujiuchi, am I right?

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We thank you in advance for your amazing contribution to our show, and hope that you will also come see it! You can head over to recurringjohn.com for more details, or purchase tickets directly at http://summerworks.ca/2014/portfolio/recurring-john/

    Thank you in advance for all your help!

Take a look at our perks to see what those dollars can get you! Who doesn't want a private concert from Kevin Wong and Chris Tsujiuchi, am I right?
  Other Ways You Can Help We thank you in advance for your amazing contribution to our show, and hope that you will also come see it! You can head over to recurringjohn.com for more details, or purchase tickets directly at http://summerworks.ca/2014/portfolio/recurring-john/
Thank you in advance for all your help!

story:
**Donate as little as $1 for Lee and make a difference**

Help me get 'Lee' off a park bench this winter and back into society. Lee is currently homeless and is about to face another winter out in the cold.

Lee lost his path a few years ago and now lives a life on the streets.

He as a very affable character and a permement resident of various benches of the affluent West Hull villages, regretfully to date no-one has helped him from this durge. 

Recently Lee showed me some of his artwork of the Titanic which he had drawn from memory...amazingly accurate and artistic...and that was only with a pencil in an old notebook that he had found.

I have started this campaign to be able to obtain/rent a small building and supply basic facilities such as heating, running water and some artist materials.

My aim is to allow Lee to shelter out from the cold, where with a little help he can develop his skills and feel wanted and part of society again, perhaps even regaining enough self-esteem to eventually be able to sell his work and have a self sustained life.

In reality I'll be happy just knowing he's indoors for this winter. Thank you in advance for all your contributions.

story:
UPDATE: Since launching our crowdfunding campaign in March, we have raised more than $40,000 online and more than $20,000 offline for Route 66: The Road and the Romance, opening June 8! We have raised about $61,000 total, or 92% of our campaign goal!

-------------------------------------------

Be part of history by supporting the Autry National Center of the American West’s upcoming exhibition, Route 66: The Road and the Romance! This summer, we want visitors to experience our museum like never before. 

Route 66 is a one-of-a-kind exhibition that captures the spirit and history of the iconic road, from the nostalgic to the turbulent to the artistic creations it inspired. The exhibition will trace the Mother Road as an important landmark of Western history and explore its impact on American culture. 

Your gift—at any level—will support our fundraising campaign for this unprecedented exhibition about Route 66. Help us engage multiple generations of visitors through dynamic and interactive displays and films plus a rich lineup of related public programs—everything from Beat poetry nights to classic car days and a Route 66 Lego® Day for families. 

 For supporting our efforts, we will thank you with a variety of perks, including private tours, souvenirs, and access to exclusive events.

Questions? Contact us: communications@theautry.org.

Why This Exhibition Is Significant

Connecting Chicago to Los Angeles, Route 66 was a major transportation artery, a popular tourist destination, and a frequent subject of popular culture throughout the twentieth century. Although it was primarily in use for only a few decades, popular culture and a sense of nostalgia firmly established Route 66 as a powerful symbol of twentieth-century America by the time the road was officially decommissioned in 1985. 

Route 66: The Road and the Romance will feature an estimated 200 historical artifacts from institutions and private collections across the United States, many of which have never been on display together in one venue and likely never will be again. The exhibition will be the first of its kind to examine from a national perspective the facts and fiction surrounding Route 66.

Where the Contributions Will Go

Funds raised through this campaign will support the exhibition and related programs—and help ensure we tell this amazing story in a spectacular way. You will be awed by the design of the galleries and the depth of content that will be presented from June 2014 to January 2015.

What Will Be in the Exhibition

Whether you’re a literary type or a classic car aficionado, there will be something in the show for you to love. See the oldest existing Route 66 shield alongside vintage gas pumps and neon art. Read from the pages of John Steinbeck’s original handwritten manuscript for The Grapes of Wrath and Jack Kerouac’s typewriter scroll of On the Road. Be moved by Dorothea Lange’s powerful photographs and Woody Guthrie’s Martin guitar, along with countless objects adorned with the Route 66 moniker or acquired along the route. 

And, for the first time, the Autry will display a classic Corvette inside the museum.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can’t contribute, you can help our cause by sharing our Route 66 campaign with your friends and family through social media. Every bit helps! 

Thank You 

Your generosity plays a key role in helping the Autry continue its mission to bring together the stories of all peoples of the American West, connecting the past with the present to inspire our shared future. Thank you. 

A portion of your contribution may be tax deductible. Please consult your tax advisor. 

-

VIDEO CREDITS 

Special thanks to Brittany Campbell, Alban Cooper, Micki Davis, Maren Dougherty, Jim Farber, Marlene Head, Anna Chiaretta Lavatelli, Stacy Lieberman, Andrew Mandinach, Amy Nance, Anna Norville, Jeffrey Richardson, Marcy Rodriguez, Jennifer Warner, John Warner, and W. Richard West, Jr.

Additional thanks to Troup-London Music/Meyer Sack for use of "(Get Your Kicks on) Route 66" by Bobby Troup.

Video produced by the Balboa Park Online Collaborative.

-

More About Us 

Autry National Center of the American West 

The Autry is a museum dedicated to exploring and sharing the stories, experiences, and perceptions of the diverse peoples of the American West, connecting the past with the present to inspire our shared future. The museum presents a wide range of exhibitions and public programs—including lectures, film, theatre, festivals, family events, and music—and performs scholarship, research, and educational outreach. The Autry’s collection of more than 500,000 pieces of art and artifacts includes the Southwest Museum of the American Indian Collection, one of the largest and most significant of Native American materials in the United States. 

E-mail: communications@theautry.org.

*Perk dependent on staff availability and advance notice.

story:
*All Barefoot Bowls are made with food safe glaze on the inside so that it is safe to eat out of and store food in. They are not, however, microwave or dishwasher safe. 

The Barefoot Bowl Project

     My name is Lucy, and I'm the creater of Barefoot Ceramics. I started making Barefoot Bowls in my home hand building studio. I would like to make lots of them using pieces made on a potters wheel.

     Potters wheels are expensive, and thats why my goal is set at $1,000. If I reach this goal, about $900 of it will go towards the actual wheel and the rest will go to clay, glaze, firing costs, & shipping of perks. If I find a cheaper wheel or have more money left over after clay, glaze, and shipping costs (which is unlikely unless I make more than my goal) it will be put towards a kiln. If I do not reach my goal, I will have to save up the rest of the funds myself (which will take a VERY long time because living is Santa Cruz isn't cheap!!)

       Contributing to the Barefoot Bowl Project will not only make me ecstatic. You will receive unique one of a kind perks. What is shown in the video is just the tip of the iceberg of possibilities of how this project can grow.

The Footprints

              The Barefoot Bowl project simply can not grow without your support. Supporting this project is also supporting me as an artist. With your help I may flourish in the art of pottery and continue on to become a happy and successful potter. I have the enthusiasm, creativity, and determination and am confidant in my ability to provide fantastic perks. The world needs Barefoot Bowls and you can help make it happen! You don't even need to contribute much.

Barebones Support!

             If you aren't in the financial position to contribute you can still help! Spread the word using the Indiegogo share tools or just tell people about my project. Any support is valuable to me and I greatly appreciate those who do.

story:
*Campaign Has Ended*

I want to give a huge Thank You! to every single person who contributed to this campaign. You've chosen to contribute to a great cause and I hope to have all your awesome wristbands shipped on their way in the next few months. Next week I will be placing the order with the manufacturer and I will provide updates on estimated deliveries from there. I appreciate your patients and understanding as I work on getting you your wristbands as soon as I can.

Thank you again, and as always #ReleaseTheSnyderCut!

[Updated 5/31/20]

 

"Quis custodiet ipsos custodes?"

"Who watches the Watchmen?"

The age old question, but finally, we have an answer: Us. All of us. We watch and speak truth to power. The #ReleaseTheSnyderCut community see and speak up to those who have control over these larger than life heroes and their stories. But today is about solidarity. No matter your clan, no matter your nation, heritage, political alignment, religious affiliation or lack there of, today we all unite under one banner yet again: #ReleaseTheSnyderCut

Let the watchmen wristband be a symbol of our re-commitment to this noble cause. Let the powers that be, recognize the unity we share and the strength we show. On November 17th 2019, we all demonstrated remarkable unity by generating over 1 million tweets, and with a little help from the Justice League cast, crew, & Director himself, we trended to #1 World Wide on Twitter. This sent Warner Brothers a clear message and overwhelming evidence that we are only getting stronger. Together we stood and showed the world a small taste of what we (united) are capable of.

Today we wish to recapture that energy, renew our bonds of unity, and look to the future, a very hopeful future. We encourage all Snyder Cut supporters to join us in raising awareness for #ReleaseTheSnyderCut, and of course, all funds raised will be donated to the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention. Will Rowlands has agreed to return and manage this campaign as he's done faithfully so many times for us in the past. 

This campaign will be limited to one month and at the end of that month, after you've received your wristband in the mail, we will make an announcement here and via @RTSnyderCut and ask that you take a picture of you wearing it and post your image to social media on a certain TBA date with our hashtag: "#ReleaseTheSnyderCut". Please feel free to also purchase wristbands for your friends, family, and anyone else you can spread the word to.

Join us in this limited time campaign to show the world once again, that we are united for artistic integrity, for suicide awareness, and justice for Zack Snyder's Justice League. #ReleaseTheSnyderCut

 

Special thanks to @NoscoOutlaw on twitter for the wristband mock-up images.

story:
The song

'Canto' was written to a text by Tonino Guerra. The song was written in Polish and Italian. The English subs will be added to the video:

Canto

The cunt is a spiderweb 

a funnel of silk 

the heart of all flowers; 

the cunt is a door 

going who knows where 

or a wall 

you have to knock down. 

 

There are happy cunts 

cunts that are totally crazy 

cunts that are wide or tight 

worthless cunts

chatterboxes that stutter, 

and those that yawn 

and don't say a word 

even if you kill them. 

 

The cunt is a mountain 

white with sugar, 

a forest entered by wolves, 

it's a carriage that pulls the horses; 

the cunt is an empty whale 

filled with black air and fireflies; 

it's the prick's pocket, 

its nightcap, 

an oven that burns everything. 

 

The cunt when it's time 

is the face of God, 

his mouth. 

 

Everything in the world comes out from the cunt 

the trees, the clouds, the sea 

and men come out one at a time 

from every race. 

[…]

Link to audio: https://omegaimpact.bandcamp.com/track/canto

 

Veniamin & Grzegorz

Veniamin Kazachenko is an visual artist based in Amsterdam.

Grzegorz Marciniak is a musician based in The Hague. 

In the past couple of years  they worked together on various projects. The most spectacular work they did (together with a bunch of other artists) was called 'WEDNESDAY' (https://vimeo.com/29523773) which won a price at the 32nd Wroclaw Stage Song Review Festival in 2011. 'WEDNESDAY' was based on an original idea by Grzegorz. It was a performance about 'an astronout' who goes into space forever. During the performance 'the astronaut' would give 'a goodbye-hug' to every member of the public before entering 'a rocket' and then leaving Earth forever. The performance was premiered in late 2010 at DeltA Center For Contemporary Art in The Hague and then performed again in March 2011 in Wroclaw.

The current project - the art video to one of OMEGA IMPACT songs - is based on the idea by Grzegorz. The video will consist of several short scenes of cutting different types of wood by a couple of female performers. The short scenes will be recorded each in different style with variety of costumes and scenography. Additionally to that, the sounds of cuting wood will be recorded and mixed with the audio of the song. The video will be shot in one of the squats in The Hague.

 

OMEGA IMPACT

Omega Impact (OI) is a post-retro music group based in The Hague. OI plays original music written for the group. So far OI gave over 50 concerts in The Netherlands, Belgium, Germany and Poland performing at concert halls, music clubs, art galleries, music schools, cultural centers, public libaries, open spaces, private apartments, squats and a prison in Nowogard/Poland. The landmark of the group is its instrumentation: voice, melodicas, recorders, clarinets, harmoniums, bass guitar and percussion. The group strives for as little amplification as possible bringing natural acoustics of the instruments to the public.

https://omegaimpact.bandcamp.com/

https://www.youtube.com/user/omegaimpactmusic

https://www.facebook.com/omega.impact.music/

 

Thank You

Any form of support is welcome. Sharing the link to this page and telling about it to your friends helps too. Thank you in advance,

Veniamin & Grzegorz

story:
THE ART GRIST: An Expanded Vision

Four years ago, The Art Grist started up as a quirky little art camp in the middle of Griffith Park in Los Angeles. Heather Newlin and Kristin Gunnarson, the two artists and educators who founded The Art Grist, are now working to expand its mission. Currently, they are building an art community that is multi-generational, and engages artists of various abilities and backgrounds.

Along with continuing to provide noteworthy educational services for children, The Art Grist is excited to be providing:

  • Classes and workshops for children, teens and adults.
  • Open studio for all those out there who need the materials, space, advice or artistic camaraderie to create something extraordinary.
  • Support for emerging artists with services such as critique circles and collaborative production groups, making it a place of growth a professional development.
  • Art Gallery to highlight the work of unique and interesting artists.

The Art Grist believes that providing each of these services together, under one roof, makes for a dynamic art community. Great art making has a huge impact on Art Education, and Art Education is an essential part of creating great Art. Artists of all ages and skill levels, informing and inspiring the next painting, the next piece of pottery, the next couture dress - that comes from a vibrant art community.

Support

Kristin and Heather have saved and saved for this moment, and they are putting their entire savings into the project. They are now reaching out to supporters to make sure that not only will The Art Grist open its doors, but keep them open for a long time to come. Every dollar that comes from this campaign will ensure that this art community has a home and can put together stellar events for all to enjoy.

We Need Your Help

Yes, The Art Grist is asking for donations to get off the ground, but that's just the start. Please tell everyone you know about The Art Grist and its new mission. We want to reach out to as many people as possible, and in this, we need your help. To truly create a rich, living community, we need creative people to engage and work with. So we invite you to come to our events, workshops, classes and openings - and bring a friend or two.

story:
who we are

It all started with two very simple TRUTHS: we love ART and we're crazy about T-SHIRTS. So we decided to create a community of artists that can express themselves using t-shirts as their canvas.

 In Puerto Rico you can find art everywhere…from amazing urban murals on the walls of one of the poorest parts of San Juan, to world-class museums, sculptures, tattoos and more…is like we say: “from artists, looneys and kings, everyone has their thing”, or something like that…

 Here we like to show who we really are and we do so with creative expressions every day. That’s why Taparrabo will help unite many local and international artists in one community where they can showcase their work, sell their designs on t-shirts and get people to know them for their ART.

And so we ensure ART continues to be developed in Puerto Rico, we will share part of our profits with the Crearte Foundation. This way we can grow that community from within and spread this crazy mission we have of Dusting Out Daily Worries One Masterpiece at a Time.

what does Taparrabo mean

Taparrabo is the Spanish word for loincloth. The loincloth is a basic form of dress, often worn as an only garment, especially in societies where no other clothing is needed or wanted.

Basically a Taparrabo is what our native Indians used to wear to hide their stuff! So why Taparrabo? Well it was the first and most basic piece of clothing from our ancestors and t-shirts are our #1 choice of wear today…

what we need

We want to make this happen and to do so we need three main things:

1. The design and development of our complete website (aprox. cost of $12,000) that includes:

    • Our artists’ community showing who they are, their portfolios, links to contact them, etc.
    • The online store that allows you to browse by artist, category, color…
    • A Create-Your-Own web designer tool, so people can make their customized designs online
    • Our blog, impact on our community and more

    2. A digital direct-to-garment printer to print full color designs on our high-quality 100% ringspun cotton t-shirts; these printers prices average from $10,000 to $20,000.

     3. A new iron press to seal the ink on the t-shirts that goes for $750.

     

    And there are many more expenses that we need to cover to make this happen...but with our life savings, bank loans and other sources of income we’ll have to manage…

    what you get

    We know you just like to help out projects you believe in and want to see succeed; this is why you do it!

    And even though you’ll get our most sincere and heartfelt appreciation for helping us out with our dream… we’ve come up with additional art-related perks to make your contribution even more worthwhile.

     

    what's the impact this will have

    This community is a medium for artists to share their work with the world and in return, they get to network, sell their designs and we’ll share part of the profits with the Crearte Foundation that helps develop more artists in Puerto Rico via education and practice… 

    Crearte was founded over 13 years ago offering services to kids and youngsters (6-21yrs) to develop their values and character through ART. Their core values are commitment, community, creativity, having fun and justice...and their mission is facilitating alternatives to develop their emotional and social potential through art, recreation and learning. 

    So it’s a virtuous cycle that will make our existence in this planet more interesting and inspiring through ART.

    Like Picasso would say: “The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls”… Meaning that the more art you get, the freer our soul is!

     

     

    how else can you help

    Hey, not everything's about just money...there are also additional ways you can help us out:

    • Talk about this project with other people and how we need more art in our world
    • Like our Facebook page (www.facebook.com/taparrabopr) and share it with your friends
    • Contact all the artists you know and tell them about Taparrabo so they can join our community
    • Buy our t-shirts and support the Crearte Foundation to develop more artists everyday

    Thanks so much for your contribution!

    Cheers,

    The Taparrabo Team

Thanks so much for your contribution! 
Cheers,

story:
Creating Community through Arts and Conversation

The New Freedom Project brings communities together by celebrating the stories of the ancestors. This project will engage audiences in a journey through history, asking them to remember their ancestors and to find and retell their stories - the American story.

 As an artist, my work is inspired by stories that illustrate the power of women throughout history. This project pays tribute to "Aunt Gina", an African-American woman who served the Scott family, prior to and during the Civil War, and whose descendants remained in service to the family, research implies, even up until the founding of Agnes Scott College in 1889. 
The project draws from genealogical research conducted by anthropologist, Mark Auslander, author of "Accidental Slaveowner: Revisiting a Myth of Race and Finding an American Family" published by UGA Press in 2011.  Auslander's research recently informed the work of visual artist and former, ASC professors, Lynn Marshall-Linnemeier, which commemorated the life of Catherine Boyd, an enslaved woman who served the first board chair of Emory, Bishop James Andrew, ultimately inspiring the naming of Catherine Boyd as  a founder of Emory University - on their 150th anniversary.
This project will:
  • Include further research into the history and the story of Aunt Gina, her descendants and others in service to the college as well as other ancestors related to the college,
  • Result in a multi-media visual arts installation which will incorporate ancestral images (photographs and other archival materials) contributed by members of the community including, current students, faculty, alumna and staff - with a special focus on telling the story of "Aunt Gina" and others in service to the college.

We need your support to make this project possible. 

All funds raised will pay for travel and research, materials and fabrication of the work, and finally documentation of the process, the audience engagement and community impact with hopes to create future funding and execution of a larger project. 

The Impact

This project will serve as a starting point and a rallying cry for conversation and understanding as the community responds to the complex history of slavery and servitude and its legacy today. 

By bringing the community together to reflect and commit to conversation, this project will:

    • Engage the community by encouraging contributions of other ancestral images, materials and stories to be included in the final installation,
    • By reflecting on common themes of legacy, ancestry and history, encourage community dialogue across traditional barriers of age, class and ethnicity,
    • Research and find descendants of "Aunt Gina", Ella Carey, John Flint and others in order to embrace their legacy and place within the community as contributing founders as well.

Photograph by Gabrielle Shepard

About the Artist, Charmaine Minniefield

Charmaine Minniefield has served as a producer and arts administrator for nearly 20 years, holding positions with such arts organizations as the National Black Arts Festival, the High Museum of Art, the Martin Luther King Center, Jr. for Nonviolent Social Change and the Fulton County Department of Arts and Culture.  As a visual artist her work explores African and African-American ritual from a feminist perspective.  Her community-based arts residency entitled, The New Freedom Project continues to be featured in communities across the country.

In 1991, Charmaine became  the first African-American class president in Agnes Scott's history. Just at it's centennial year, her arrival was at a transitional period for the college. It was with her class that the number of students of color at Agnes Scott reached historical highs and significant events around race and social justice were happening worldwide.  From the release of Nelson Mandela and the end of Apartheid to the Rodney King Riots both on the west coast and in Atlanta just outside campus walls, the ASC community ultimately saw the need to create such organizations as Racism Free Zone, a forum on racial justice which opened the campus to dialogue. It was during this time that classmate Malikah Berry ’94, founded Nandi the black women’s literary publication and Witkaze, which means “sisterhood” in Swahili was also revived. Charmaine Minniefield was class president for all 4 years of her time at Agnes Scott, serving the community in a number of leadership roles. She also served on the presidential search committee alongside former ASC Board Chair, Joe Gladden to finally select President Mary Brown Bullock as the next president of the college.


Our overall fundraising goal is $10K

This $5K is a start - we can surpass it.

This is an ambitious project with a very short window for execution. It is our goal to be off and running as the monies come in. Please forgive our aggressive efforts to fund raise. If we are not able to reach our goals we are limited to:

  • The limited research that has been done thus far on "Aunt Gina" and her descendants, as well as others,
  • Not being able to include images from the collective community because of the process (materials and equipment) needed to do so,
  • Not having all the elements of artistic design as envisioned. 
In spite of these challenges, we are prepared to achieve what is possible based on what limited resources exist - because we believe in this cause.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to give a cash contribution - NO WORRIES! You may help in the following ways:

  • Contribute images of your ancestors.  Its very exciting to see how the ancestors affect change.
  • Lend us your equipment - we NEED small video projectors for the installation. If you have access to them and would not mind loaning them for the course of the project (January -May), that would be awesome
  • Help with fabrication - if you have a talent that might be contributed, please call me directly at 404-202-2271. This project is an artistic collaboration. Many artists are already confirmed - your part is welcome.
  • Lend your frequent flyer miles. Our collaborators live on the west coast and your miles will go towards their travel. 
  • Spread the word!

story:
Painting the South

I am Claudia Massie, an artist from Scotland. This summer, I will be travelling around Southern France and Northern Spain in search of new landscapes to paint. I will record the landscapes I encounter in sketches and plein air paintings and then produce a series of larger works in the studio when I return home.

Three years ago, I did a similar expedition across Northern Europe, driving from Holland to Norway via Germany, Denmark and Sweden. The trip was genuinely inspirational and the experience of documenting the fresh landscapes and intense light and colours of the Northern summer had a significant impact upon my approach to painting.

Wooden cabins in the forest at Åybtorp, Sweden

I had a baby last year and this summer's expedition will represent my return to painting. I am eager to get to work again after a break of a few months and have no doubt that the new landscapes I encounter will be stimulating and fruitful. My family will accompany me on this trip and while I paint they will enjoy their own adventures. 

Painting in the shade, Skåne, Sweden

Why get involved?

It is important to me to seek fresh inspiration in new landscapes and my experience of overseas previous expeditions has been hugely positive. As such, I will do this trip in some form regardless of any external funding but being able to share the work I produce will both help extend the adventure and make it more challenging (there's a certain pressure involved when you know your sketches must be shared) and a lot of fun (it's exciting to work like this). I hope that any potential backers will be thrilled by the prospect of receiving an original piece of art through the mail by the end of the summer, or a larger oil painting by Christmas.

Perks: what you will receive

I am offering a range of "perks" from postcards and plein air acrylic studies to large, framed oil paintings. This is your chance to commission a unique, original artwork, some of which will be mailed direct from locations along my journey.

If you choose to get involved with this venture, I will select your commissioned picture from the strongest work produced during the trip. What you receive will be my choice - this is part of the enjoyment! However, I am happy to accommodate specific requests too. It is essential that everyone who contributes is happy with what they receive.

Exhibition of my work during my previous travels at the Radøy Kunstsenter, Norway

The Impact

I can't wait to get painting again and the opportunity to re-engage with the process of looking and drawing and painting in a new environment is, as ever, tremendously exciting. During my previous expedition, I produced around 70 new pieces of art ranging from postcard sized sketches to large oil paintings. I would hope to be equally productive this time and return home with a substantial body of new work, the best of which will be dispatched to backers.

Feature on my work in the exhibition in a Norwegian newspaper

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't help financially, and even if you can, please consider spreading the word about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
THIS IS YOUR LUCKY POTION ORACLE SET:

Each set includes:

  • 44 Hand-Drawn Guidance cards (3.5" x 3.5")
  • Custom 6-sided Die
  • Handbook (For the Currently Curious)
  • Certificate of Authenticity (signed and numbered by me)
  • Dice-rolling mat (4.5" x 9")
  • One Random vinyl sticker!
  • Beautiful 2-Piece Box (Not shown)

THESE ARE YOUR LUCKY POTION ORACLE GUIDANCE CARDS:

[The imagery is a mix between a bizarre dreamworld and a fantasy-land captured in tattoo style and shading. I’m so happy to present this deck with beautiful original artwork and a color scheme that I spent so long developing. I hope you enjoy it.]

THIS IS YOUR CUSTOM 6-SIDED DIE:

You could use the cards intuitively, or use this very special unique mechanic - a dice and a decision.  Each card contains a different potion bottle with a crystal stopper.  Decide if you want to drink the potion yourself, share it, or throw it. If you need help deciding, roll the special 6-sided die included in each set.   [The dice in the video are prototypes.  The final version may look slightly different.] 

THIS IS YOUR HANDBOOK FOR THE CURRENTLY CURIOUS:

[The handbook is 3.5"x3.5" The image above is a mockup. Your handbook may look slightly different.] 

THIS IS YOUR CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY:

[The Certificate may look slightly different than the one above. Each Certificate will be signed and numbered by me.]

THIS IS YOUR COTTON SPREAD CLOTH (Add-On Perk):

[This cotton cloth is 18"x18" with a 2-color design (black and white) created by me and printed by a local shop.]

THIS IS YOUR ORIGINAL ARTWORK FROM THE LUCKY POTION ORACLE COLLECTION (Add-On Perk):

[Original Art is on Illustration Board. The board dimension is roughly 7.5"x7.5" and you can see some of the "test" marks I made around the outside of the image. The artwork will have no mat or frame, but will be signed and packed with love.]

THIS IS YOUR ARCHIVAL PRINT (Add-On Perk):

[You can choose whichever card you'd like as a giclee print. It will be printed on Hot Press Bright White Archival Paper, with Archival Inks. The artwork is about 4.75"x4.75" and the outer dimensions of the paper is about 5.5"x5.5"]

THESE ARE YOUR STICKERS (Add-On Perk):

[Everyone will automatically get a random sticker.  If you want the other 4 to complete your set, add on this perk!]
