story:
OUR STORY

The Wyvern bindery was started 30 years ago by bookbinders Mark Winstanley, Rosie Grey and Hannah Moore. They established themselves in Clerkenwell Workshops, in London, and after a couple of years moved onto Clerkenwell Road, where the bindery has been ever since. While Rosie and Hannah left soon after, Mark kept the bindery going, surrounding himself with a team of highly skilled bookbinders from various backgrounds and training.

Now after all of these years, Mark is retiring. Julian, Kaori and Pauline, all employees for more than 10 years, together with the same team (Aimee, Amélie, Kate, Nick and Piotr) have decided to take on the challenge of keeping the Wyvern going and building on it's legacy.

The bindery is dedicated to preserving the highest standards of craftsmanship and we pride ourselves in our work and problem solving. Using traditional skills, we aim to produce quality work tailored to our client's specific requirements for design, budget and deadline. Our daily work includes making books, portfolios, boxes, presentation bindings, menus, photos albums and fine bindings. With repairs we aim to keep traditional bookbinding skills alive, using hand tools, gold leaf and calf leather

We welcome anyone who wants to make something using cloth, leather, paper or board, even if it’s a one-off project. We have worked with many artists, photographers, architects, design companies, students, book collectors and dealers.

More recently we have become well known for our work with film production companies. Much of our work can be seen in the props of the Harry Potter Movies, Games of Thrones and Katherine the Great and in other films like the Favourite, Sherlock Holmes and many others.

 

 

Pictures by Julian Love

 

WE ARE MOVING AND WE NEED YOUR HELP!

To help us do this, we need to move and we have found a great shop on Hoxton street, still in the heart of London and not far from Clerkenwell. We are hoping to raise enough money to fit out the new premises to allow a better experience for our customers and improve the working environment for our staff while at the same time keep the old world magic that is Clerkenwell Road alive. We are working on creating a beautiful front area where every customer feels welcome and happy to talk about their special project. We are also hoping to have a little shop where you will find bookbinding tools, decorative papers, handmade note books, photos albums and much more. Much of the bindery needs renewal and we want to replace the old workbenches with new adjustable work surfaces and better storage.

Being part of the community is important to us and we know we will become a valuable member of Hoxton Street. All our efforts will make little events and tours for nearby schools and passersby much easier.

 

Kaori, Julian and Pauline in front of the new shop in Hoxton

Picture by James Spillman

 

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP US

The estimated cost of refurbishment:

- Made-to-measure finishing bench for lettering: £1200
- Made-to-measure middle bench: £1000
- 4 made-to-measure individual benches at £450 each: £1800
- Resized shelving unit to store bookcloth and leather: £3200
- Welcome counter for customers: £900
- Sample display and shelving area for customer: £600
- Customer collection shelving unit: £1000
- Safe storage for up-coming work: old books waiting to be repaired: £350
- Safe storage for up-coming work: pages waiting to be bound: £350

Total: £10400

With our predictions and calculations, the figure above is a minimum of what we will require to kit out the new place. However, any funds above that will be used to buy extra equipment (a new guillotine!) and help us cover the first few months of expenses as we begin the new chapter of the Wyvern.

We have got a number of rewards to thank you for your support, including handmade gifts, vouchers to redeem, handmade marbled papers, copies of 'Making books' from the London Centre for Book Arts, days with an experienced bookbinder here in the bindery, and much more. We will also be announcing more rewards as the campaign progresses.

It would be a great help if you could share this link with anybody who may be interested!

Thank you all for your support and for helping us keep the Wyvern bindery and the wonderful craft of bookbinding alive!

Julian, Kaori, Pauline, Aimee, Amélie, Kate, Nick and Piotr.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The risks and challenges are minimal. We have already secured the lease for the new bindery in Hoxton. All we need now is a little help in re-furbishing the new bindery and getting us on our feet.

 

POSTAGE OR COLLECTION OF YOUR PERK

Indiegogo doesn't allow for both postage and collection options. If you are able, or would prefer to collect your perk from us directly, please let us know when you place the order and we will reimburse the cost of postage when you pop in.

 

Video by James Spillman

One of the perks: A signed and limited edition from illusrator George Butler of the Wyvern Bindery on Clerkenwell Road.​

 

 

Pictures by Julian Love​​
story_txt: OUR STORYThe Wyvern bindery was started 30 years ago by bookbinders Mark Winstanley, Rosie Grey and Hannah Moore. They established themselves in Clerkenwell Workshops, in London, and after a couple of years moved onto Clerkenwell Road, where the bindery has been ever since. While Rosie and Hannah left soon after, Mark kept the bindery going, surrounding himself with a team of highly skilled bookbinders from various backgrounds and training.Now after all of these years, Mark is retiring. Julian, Kaori and Pauline, all employees for more than 10 years, together with the same team (Aimee, Amélie, Kate, Nick and Piotr) have decided to take on the challenge of keeping the Wyvern going and building on it's legacy.The bindery is dedicated to preserving the highest standards of craftsmanship and we pride ourselves in our work and problem solving. Using traditional skills, we aim to produce quality work tailored to our client's specific requirements for design, budget and deadline. Our daily work includes making books, portfolios, boxes, presentation bindings, menus, photos albums and fine bindings. With repairs we aim to keep traditional bookbinding skills alive, using hand tools, gold leaf and calf leatherWe welcome anyone who wants to make something using cloth, leather, paper or board, even if it’s a one-off project. We have worked with many artists, photographers, architects, design companies, students, book collectors and dealers.More recently we have become well known for our work with film production companies. Much of our work can be seen in the props of the Harry Potter Movies, Games of Thrones and Katherine the Great and in other films like the Favourite, Sherlock Holmes and many others.  Pictures by Julian Love WE ARE MOVING AND WE NEED YOUR HELP!To help us do this, we need to move and we have found a great shop on Hoxton street, still in the heart of London and not far from Clerkenwell. We are hoping to raise enough money to fit out the new premises to allow a better experience for our customers and improve the working environment for our staff while at the same time keep the old world magic that is Clerkenwell Road alive. We are working on creating a beautiful front area where every customer feels welcome and happy to talk about their special project. We are also hoping to have a little shop where you will find bookbinding tools, decorative papers, handmade note books, photos albums and much more. Much of the bindery needs renewal and we want to replace the old workbenches with new adjustable work surfaces and better storage.Being part of the community is important to us and we know we will become a valuable member of Hoxton Street. All our efforts will make little events and tours for nearby schools and passersby much easier. Kaori, Julian and Pauline in front of the new shop in HoxtonPicture by James Spillman HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP USThe estimated cost of refurbishment:- Made-to-measure finishing bench for lettering: £1200- Made-to-measure middle bench: £1000- 4 made-to-measure individual benches at £450 each: £1800- Resized shelving unit to store bookcloth and leather: £3200- Welcome counter for customers: £900- Sample display and shelving area for customer: £600- Customer collection shelving unit: £1000- Safe storage for up-coming work: old books waiting to be repaired: £350- Safe storage for up-coming work: pages waiting to be bound: £350Total: £10400With our predictions and calculations, the figure above is a minimum of what we will require to kit out the new place. However, any funds above that will be used to buy extra equipment (a new guillotine!) and help us cover the first few months of expenses as we begin the new chapter of the Wyvern.We have got a number of rewards to thank you for your support, including handmade gifts, vouchers to redeem, handmade marbled papers, copies of 'Making books' from the London Centre for Book Arts, days with an experienced bookbinder here in the bindery, and much more. We will also be announcing more rewards as the campaign progresses.It would be a great help if you could share this link with anybody who may be interested!Thank you all for your support and for helping us keep the Wyvern bindery and the wonderful craft of bookbinding alive!Julian, Kaori, Pauline, Aimee, Amélie, Kate, Nick and Piotr. RISKS AND CHALLENGESThe risks and challenges are minimal. We have already secured the lease for the new bindery in Hoxton. All we need now is a little help in re-furbishing the new bindery and getting us on our feet. POSTAGE OR COLLECTION OF YOUR PERKIndiegogo doesn't allow for both postage and collection options. If you are able, or would prefer to collect your perk from us directly, please let us know when you place the order and we will reimburse the cost of postage when you pop in. Video by James SpillmanOne of the perks: A signed and limited edition from illusrator George Butler of the Wyvern Bindery on Clerkenwell Road.​  Pictures by Julian Love​​

story:
Short Summary

That's a mighty firm grip...
  • Bonjour Bonjour! I'm Jesse, I'm 28 and I'm newly engaged. I'm currently contracted to work on a project for Google and am a dual native of New Orleans and the Oakland Bay Area.
  • A team of people have given their life blood and energy to make this possible. With over 3 years and 3,000 hours of work poured into THIS product.
  • I believe we can mend the link between younger generations & reading, the key is a fresh introduction to how story can be prepared and shared. That's why we've created Oiseau.

What We Need & What You Get

Let me, let me, let me...Break it down like a fraction:

  • We're seeding 3K for the first 500 books. From there we will sell online, to schools and in local retailers.
  • We've taken time to create high-quality incentive packages to enhance your experience. We encourage you to not only get the novel itself, but some of the amazing quality apparel from the highly-followed graphic artists we work with illustrating scenes (as they see it) from within the novel.
  • Your product is guaranteed. 

The Impact

X-Ray. Check. Telescope. Check:
  • The heart of Oiseau is to make reading a 360 experience. Our plan to do that is partnering with artists from around the world on one literary project. So they can bring to the world products which reflect the drama of this award-winning story.
  • We raised 6K in 30 days on our last campaign. But since we fell a few steps short weren't able to benefit from any of the wonderfuly pledged support. We have the gift of experience, and with dedicated seeding, will reach our mission.

Risks & Challenges

What happens if there's a delay in print?

We've screened multiple printers searching. In the world of lit, printing complications do happen, which is why we have four other printers in place as insurance.  Our aim is to deliver a top product by the date promised.

What about holdups in Art or Design?

Good question. We think the art is absolutely crucial. It's your first introduction and a great way to distinguish your story. Never fear, we've taken the last 3 months to finalize this process BEFORE the start of our funding. No delays while we choose pallets, themes, symbols, negotiate rights, medium or design-style. The artwork is laid out and ready for print.

What happens if my Product is Damaged?

We will return all products damaged in shipping

What about editing?

The story's been edited by a professional of over 25 years in the market. She has the range of New York Times Best-Sellers to personal projects and has helped guide this piece and many others to full completion.


Sharing = Caring!


  • Sharing is the way we make our impact on the world of reading! Help us share this wonderful story!

story:
For a full view of the image, see the original at Furaffinity

Once you buy a slot, please note Wen on FA with which slot you purchased and the email address associated with your donation, your character references, and any other details requested in the Perks! Thank you!

Short Summary

Artists Wen & Tato have been serving the babyfur community for over two years, providing adorable art for the young at heart. This month, we're doing a fun Easter themed fundraiser for St Jude Children's Research Hospital!

Rules & Info

We're asking for you to buy a slot in this Your Character Here Easter image. Here's what you'll get:

  • Your character gets featured in the slot # of your choice!
  • You choose your outfit
  • The Easter bunny slot will either be dressed as a bunny, or transformed into a bunny. Your choice, but it must be an Easter Bunny.
  • Fan characters are permitted
  • Must provide full color references
  • Age & body type are a fixed aspect

The Impact

100% of the proceeds will go to St Jude Children's Research Hospital. If you've ever enjoyed the colorful art that comes from the babyfur community, take this chance to give back to needy children and make their Easter one to remember!

Other Ways You Can Help

Any donations are accepted towards this cause! All donators' names will be mentioned & linked to in the final image to be posted at FurAffinity.net (Please provide your FurAffinity screename when you donate!)
